quote: In Paris they simply stared when I spoke to them in French  I never did succeed in making those idiots understand their own language.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Lovers of air travel find it exhilarating to hang poised between the illusion of immortality and the fact of death.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make  And better friends I'll not be knowing  Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take  No matter where it's going.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: One sees great things from the valley  only small things from the peak.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The American arrives in Paris with a few French phrases he has culled from a conversational guide or picked up from a friend who owns a beret.
author: Fred Allen

quote: The crow  when travelling abroad  came back just as black.
author: English proverb

quote: The journey is the reward.
author: Tao saying

quote: The routines of tourism are even more monotonous than those of daily life.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: The time to enjoy a European trip is about three weeks after unpacking.
author: George Ade

quote: There is a ghost That eats handkerchiefs  It keeps you company On all your travels.
author: Christian Morgenstern

quote: I like terra firma - the more firma  the less terra.
author: George S. Kaufman

quote: When I was at home  I was in a better place  but travellers must be content.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I have travelled a good deal in Concord.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A bred-in-the-bone Boston lady  when asked why she never travelled  said 'Why should I? I'm already there.'
author: Anonymous

quote: It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The early North American Indian made a great mistake by not having an immigration bureau.
author: Anonymous

quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice  bigotry and narrow-mindedness.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Every perfect traveller always creates the country where he travels.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: No man should travel until he has learned the language of the country he visits  otherwise he voluntarily makes himself a great baby - so helpless and ridiculous.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: As the Spanish proverb says  'He who would bring home the wealth of the Indies  must carry the wealth of the Indies with him.' So it is with traveling. A man must carry knowledge with him if he would bring home knowledge.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: How much a dunce that has been sent to roam Excels a dunce that has been kept at home!
author: William Cowper

quote: The traveller's-eye view of men and women is not satisfying. A man might spend his life in trains and restaurants and know nothing of humanity at the end. To know  one must be an actor as well as a spectator.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: My favourite thing is to go where I've never been.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: Usually speaking  the worst-bred person in company is a young traveller just returned from abroad.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: For my part  I travel not to go anywhere  but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: I met a lot of people in Europe. I even encountered myself.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Travel is ninety per cent anticipation and ten per cent recollection.
author: Edward Streeter

quote: If one had but a single glance to give the world  one should gaze on Istanbul.
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quote: There is no unhappiness like the misery of sighting land again after a cheerful  careless voyage.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Before he sets out  the traveller must possess fixed interests and facilities  to be served by travel. If he drifted aimlessly from country to country he would not travel but only wander  ramble as a tramp. The traveller must be somebody and come from somewhere so his definite character and moral traditions may supply an organ and a point of comparison for his observations.
author: George Santayana

quote: When you travel  remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Wherever I travel  I'm too late. The orgy has moved elsewhere.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: (Airplanes) may kill you  but they ain't likely to hurt you.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man  then wherever you go for the rest of your life  it stays with you  for Paris is a movable feast.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Old men and far travellers may lie with authority.
author: Anonymous

quote: Russia is the only country of the world you can be homesick for while you're still in it.
author: John Updike

quote: Travel teaches toleration.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I am fevered with the sunset  I am fretful with the bay  For the wander-thirst is on me And my soul is in Cathay.
author: Richard Hovey

quote: As the Spanish proverb says  "He who would bring home the wealth of the Indies must carry the wealth of the Indies with him." So it is in traveling: a man must carry knowledge with him  if he would bring home knowledge.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Down to Gehenna or up to the throne  He travels the fastest who travels alone.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The more I see of other countries the more I love my own.
author: Mme. De Stael

quote: The little Road says  Go  The little House says  Stay  And oh  it's bonny here at home  But I must go away.
author: Josephine P. Peabody

quote: Good company in a journey makes the way to seem the shorter.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Treachery  though at first very cautious  in the end betrays itself.
author: Livy

quote: Et tu Brute! (You too  Brutus!)
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A tree depicts divinest plan  But God himself lives in a man.
author: Anonymous

quote: This is the forest primeval.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Tall oaks from little acorns grow.
author: David Everett

quote: The tree of knowledge of good and evil.
author: Bible

quote: Poems are made by fools like me  But only God can make a tree.
author: Joyce Kilmer

quote: The tree is known by his fruit.
author: Matthew

quote: Woodman  spare that tree! Touch not a single bough! In youth it sheltered me  And I'll protect it now.
author: George P. Morris

quote: Tis a lesson you should heed  Try  try  try again If at first you don't succeed  Try  try  try again.
author: W. E. Hickson

quote: There are no crown-bearers in heaven who were not cross-bearers here below.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Help to make earth happy  like the heaven above.
author: Julia F. Carney

quote: For precept must be upon precept  precept upon precept  line upon line  line upon line  here a little  and there a little.
author: Bible

quote: A little one shall become a thousand  and a small one a strong nation.
author: Bible

quote: Events of great consequence often spring from trifling circumstances.
author: Livy

quote: Trifles make perfection - and perfection is no trifle.
author: Michelangelo

quote: For the maintenance of peace  nations should avoid the pin-pricks which forerun cannon-shots.
author: Napoleon

quote: Never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
author: American Proverb

quote: He that seeks trouble always finds it.
author: English proverb

quote: Troubles  like babies  grow larger by nursing.
author: Lady Holland

quote: Man is born unto trouble  as the sparks fly upward.
author: Bible

quote: To take arms against a sea of troubles.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Though life is made up of mere bubbles  'Tis better than many aver  For while we've a whole lot of troubles  The most of them never occur.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: True love is like ghosts  which everybody talks about and few have seen.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: True love is eternal  infinite  and always like itself. It is equal and pure  without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Generally  by the time you are Real  most of your hair has been loved off  and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all  because once you are Real you can't be ugly  except to people who don't understand.
author: Margery Williams

quote: All kings  and all their favourites  All glory of honours  beauties  wits  The sun itself  which makes time  as they pass  Is elder by a year now than it was When thou and I first one another saw. All other things to their destruction draw  Only our love hath no decay  This no to-morrow hath  nor yesterday  Running it never runs from us away  But truly keeps his first  last  everlasting day.
author: John Donne

quote: Love looks not with the eyes  but with the mind  And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: True love brings up everything you're allowing a mirror to be held up to you daily.
author: Jennifer Aniston

quote: Perfect love is rare indeed - for to be a lover will require that you continually have the subtlety of the very wise  the flexibility of the child  the sensitivity of the artist  the understanding of the philosopher  the acceptance of the saint  the tolerance of the scholar and the fortitude of the certain.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: True love is night jasmine  a diamond in darkness  the heartbeat no cardiologist has ever heard. It is the most common of miracles  fashioned of fleecy clouds a handful of stars tossed into the night sky.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: Some love lasts a lifetime. True love lasts forever.
author: Anonymous

quote: What the heart gives away is never gone.... It is kept in the hearts of others.
author: Robin St. John

quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength  while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Love me without fear Trust me without questioning Need me without demanding Want me without restrictions Accept me without change Desire me without inhibitions For a love so free . . . Will never fly away.
author: Dick Sutphen

quote: The Eskimo has fifty-two names for snow because it is important to them  there ought to be as many for love.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: A romp in the hay lingers like the first line of a song  but your true love is the one you make a life with and write more than a line about  you write a whole book.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: The greatest happiness in life is the conviction that we are loved - loved for ourselves  or rather  loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I love thee  I love but thee With a love that shall not die Till the sun grows cold And the stars grow old.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: True love's the gift which God has given To man alone beneath the heaven: It is not fantasy's hot fire  Whose wishes soon as granted fly  It liveth not in fierce desire.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

quote: Do you want me to tell you something really subversive? Love is everything it's cracked up to be. That's why people are so cynical about it. . . . It really is worth fighting for  being brave for  risking everything for. And the trouble is  if you don't risk everything  you risk even more.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I love thee to the depth and breadth and height my soul can reach.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: True love is like ghosts  which everybody talks about and few have seen.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: True love is eternal  infinite  and always like itself. It is equal and pure  without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Generally  by the time you are Real  most of your hair has been loved off  and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all  because once you are Real you can't be ugly  except to people who don't understand.
author: Margery Williams

All other things to their destruction draw  Only our love hath no decay  This no to-morrow hath  nor yesterday  Running it never runs from us away  But truly keeps his first  last  everlasting day.
author: John Donne

quote: Love looks not with the eyes  but with the mind  And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

author: Leo Buscaglia

author: William Shakespeare

author: Jim Bishop

author: Dick Sutphen

author: Margaret Atwood

author: Garrison Keillor

quote: The greatest happiness in life is the conviction that we are loved - loved for ourselves  or rather  loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

author: William Shakespeare

quote: True love's the gift which God has given To man alone beneath the heaven: It is not fantasy's hot fire  Whose wishes soon as granted fly  It liveth not in fierce desire.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

quote: Do you want me to tell you something really subversive? Love is everything it's cracked up to be. That's why people are so cynical about it. . . . It really is worth fighting for  being brave for  risking everything for. And the trouble is  if you don't risk everything  you risk even more.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I love thee to the depth and breadth and height my soul can reach.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: The truth [is] that there is only one terminal dignity�love. And the story of a love is not important�what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely  willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved  we love to love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: The chemist who can extract from his heart's elements compassion  respect  longing  patience  regret  surprise  and forgiveness and compound them into one can create that atom which is called love.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: True love cannot be found where it truly does not exist  nor can it be hidden where it truly does.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love conquers all.
author: Virgil

quote: True love begins when nothing is looked for in return.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A promise made is a debt unpaid.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: Loyalty is still the same  Whether it win or lose the game  True as a dial to the sun  Although it be not shined upon.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Never trust the teller. Trust the tale.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: There is nothing more likely to start disagreement among people or countries than an agreement.
author: E. B. White

quote: When praying does no good  insurance does help.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: It is better to suffer wrong than to do it  and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I think that we may safely trust a good deal more than we do.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To put one's trust in God is only a longer way of saying that one will chance it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Trust me  but look to thyself.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Trust thyself only  and another shall not betray thee.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Trust one who has tried.
author: Virgil

quote: Government is a trust  and the officers of the government are trustees  and both the trust and the trustees are created for the benefit of the people.
author: Henry Clay

quote: Trust in God  and keep your powder dry.
author: Oliver Cromwell

quote: Thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed.
author: Bible

quote: When a man assumes a public trust  he should consider himself as public property.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Public office is a public trust.
author: Dan S. Lamont

quote: To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved.
author: George Macdonald

quote: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
author: Bible

quote: Truth crushed to earth shall rise again.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: 'Tis strange - but true  for truth is always strange  Stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Truth ever lovely - since the world began  The foe of tyrants  and the friend of man.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: "It was as true " said Mr. Barkis ... "as taxes is. And nothing's truer than them."
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Time is precious  but truth is more precious than time.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: For truth has such a face and such a mien  As to be lov'd needs only to be seen.
author: John Dryden

quote: Truth is immortal  error is mortal.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The greater the truth the greater the libel.
author: Lord Ellenborough

quote: And ye shall know the truth  and the truth shall make you free.
author: Bible

quote: There is no truth in him.
author: Bible

quote: 'Tis true  'tis pity  And pity 'tis 'tis true.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Truth forever on the scaffold. Wrong forever on the throne.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: My man's as true as steel.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: All great truths began as blasphemies.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It's the funniest joke in the world.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It takes two to speak the truth - one to speak  and another to hear.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: As a rule  I am very careful to be shallow and conventional where depth and originality are wasted.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quote: A misleading impression  not a lie. It was being economical with the truth.
author: Sir Robert Armstrong

quote: An exaggeration is a truth that has lost its temper.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: It is a difficult task  Oh citizens  to make speeches to the belly  which has no ears.
author: Plutarch

quote: "It was as true"  said Mr. Barkus  "as taxes is. And nothing is truer than them."
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Many people would be more truthful were it not for their uncontrollable desire to talk.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: No one means all he says and yet very few say all they mean.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Pure truth  like pure gold  has been found unfit for circulation because men have discovered that it is far more convenient to adulterate the truth than to refine themselves.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The truth is cruel  but it can be loved and it makes free those who have loved it.
author: George Santayana

quote: There are no whole truths. All truths are half-truths. It is trying to treat them as whole truths that plays the devil.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Too much truth Is uncouth.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: Truth is a child of Time
author: Don Ford

quote: Time trieth truth.
author: English proverb

quote: Truth always lags last  limping along on the arm of Time.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Truth exists. Only lies are invented.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Truth never dies but lives a wretched life.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: What a myth never contains is the critical power to separate its truth from its errors.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: The man who speaks the truth is always at ease.
author: Persian proverb

quote: Every man has a right to utter what he thinks is truth  and every other man has a right to knock him down for it.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Don't be consistent  but be simply true.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It makes all the difference in the world whether we put truth in the first place  or in the second place.
author: John Morley

quote: Rough work  iconoclasm  but the only way to get at the truth.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: When one has no design but to speak plain truth  he may say a great deal in a very narrow compass.
author: Richard Steele

quote: One can live in this world on soothsaying but not on truth saying.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: For my part  whatever anguish of spirit it may cost  I am willing to know the whole truth - to know the worst and provide for it.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: Truth has a handsome countenance but torn garments.
author: German proverb

quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose. Take which you please  you can never have both.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Some people handle the truth carelessly  Others never touch it at all.
author: Anonymous

quote: Truth for him was a moving target  he never aimed for the bull and rarely pierced the outer ring.
author: Hugh Cudlipp

quote: Seeing's believing - but feeling is God's own truth.
author: Irish proverb

quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth  and truth rewarded me.
author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

quote: Every emancipation has in it the seeds of a new slavery  and every truth easily becomes a lie.
author: J. F. Stone

quote: In every generation there has to be some fool who will speak the truth as he sees it.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Every truth passes through three stages before it is recognized. In the first it is ridiculed  in the second it is opposed  in the third it is regarded as self-evident.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: No one can bar the road to truth  and to advance its cause I'm ready to accept even death.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The passion for truth is silenced by answers which have the weight of undisputed authority.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: A truth that's told with bad intent Beats all the lies you can invent.
author: William Blake

quote: He who  when called upon to speak a disagreeable truth  tells it boldly and has done  is both bolder and milder than he who nibbles in a low voice and never ceases nibbling.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: We call first truths those we discover after all the others.
author: Albert Camus

quote: As scarce as truth is  the supply has always been in excess of the demand.
author: Josh Billings

quote: I speak the truth  not so much as I would  but as much as I dare  and I dare a little more  as I grow older.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Between whom there is hearty truth  there is love.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Everything has to be taken on trust  truth is only that which is taken to be true. It's the currency of living. There may be nothing behind it  but it doesn't make any difference so long as it is honoured.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: One truth discovered  one pang of regret at not being able to express it  is better than all the fluency and flippancy in the world.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: If you speak the truth have a foot in the stirrup.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: The man who fears no truths has nothing to fear from lies.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Pretty much all the honest truthtelling there is in the world is done by children.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are truths that are not for all men  nor for all times.
author: Voltaire

quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: What I tell you three times is true.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Peace if possible  but truth at any rate.
author: Martin Luther

quote: It takes two to speak the truth - one to speak  and another to hear.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you tell the truth you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There's such a thing as moderation  even in telling the truth.
author: Vera Johnson

quote: Truth is something you stumble into when you think you're going some place else.
author: Jerry Garcid

quote: We shall return to proven ways - not because they are old  but because they are true.
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: Truth emerges more readily from error than from confusion.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If you are out to describe the truth  leave elegance to the tailor.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I don't give them hell. I just tell the truth and they think it is hell.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: The truth is rarely pure  and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: How lovely are the portals of the night  When stars come out to watch the daylight die.
author: Thomas Cole

quote: The west is broken into bars Of orange  gold  and gray  Gone is the sun  come are the stars  And night infolds the day.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Twilight and evening bell And after that the dark.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Bad laws are the worst sort of tyranny.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Unlimited power corrupts the possessor  and this I know  that  where law ends  there tyranny begins.
author: Lord Chatham

quote: He who strikes terror into others is himself in continual fear.
author: Claudian

quote: Tyrants have not yet discovered any chains that can fetter the mind.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Resistance to tyrants is obedience to God.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Arbitrary power is most easily established on the ruins of liberty abused to licentiousness.
author: George Washington

quote: 'Tis time to fear when tyrants seem to kiss.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Better an ugly face than an ugly mind.
author: James Ellis

quote: Absolute and entire ugliness is rare.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Nobody's sweetheart is ugly.
author: J. J. Vade

quote: Is anyone in all the world safe from unhappiness?
author: Sophocles

quote: Unhappiness is the ultimate form of self-indulgence.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking  just as ill health indicates a bad regimen.
author: Paul Bourget

quote: Unhappiness is best defined as the difference between our talents and our expectations.
author: Dr. Edward De Bono

quote: By becoming more unhappy  we sometimes learn how to be less so.
author: Madame Swetchine

quote: Men are the only animals that devote themselves  day in and day out  to making one another unhappy.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The worst sin-perhaps the only sin- passion can commit is to be joyless.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Those who are unhappy have no need for anything in this world but people capable of giving them their attention.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Irresolution on the schemes of life I which offer themselves to our choice  and inconstancy in pursuing them  are the greatest causes of all unhappiness.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: O Lord! Unhappy is the man whom man can make unhappy.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Unhappiness is not knowing what we want and killing ourselves to get it.
author: Don Herold

quote: All mankind's unhappiness derives from one thing: his inability to know how to remain in repose in one room.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: None think the great unhappy but the great.
author: Edward Young

quote: The primary cause of unhappiness in the world today is ... lack of faith.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Sadness is a state of sin.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Fate often puts all the material for happiness and prosperity into a man's hands just to see how miserable he can make himself with them.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Whenever one finds oneself inclined to bitterness  it is a sign of emotional failure.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Then join in hand  brave Americans all! By uniting we stand  by dividing we fall.
author: John Dickinson

quote: All for one  one for all.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: We must all hang together or assuredly we shall hang separately.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity.
author: Bible

quote: By union the smallest states thrive  by discord the greatest are destroyed.
author: Sallust

quote: The union of lakes - the union of lands -  The union of States none can sever -  The union of hearts - the union of hands -  And the flag of our union for ever!
author: George P. Morris

quote: Liberty and Union  now and forever  one and inseparable.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: The mean of true valor lies between the extremes of cowardice and rashness.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Oh  wad some power the giftie gie us To see oursel's as ithers see us! It wad frae monie a blunder free us  And foolish notion.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Variety's the very spice of life  That gives it all its flavour.
author: William Cowper

quote: It takes all sorts to make a world.
author: English proverb

quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale Her infinite variety.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Every vice is only an exaggeration of a necessary and virtuous function.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: As for an authentic villain  the real thing  the absolute  the artist  one rarely meets him  even once in a lifetime. The ordinary bad hat is always in part a decent fellow.
author: Colette

quote: It is a great misfortune to be of use to nobody  scarcely less to be of use to everybody.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: It's true Heaven forbids some pleasures  but a compromise can usually be found.
author: Moliere

quote: The difference between utility and utility plus beauty is the difference between telephone wires and the spider's web.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: They also serve who only stand and wait.
author: John Milton

quote: What maintains one vice would bring up two children.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Vice goes a long way tow'rd makin' life bearable. A little vice now an' thin is relished by th' best iv men.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: When I religiously confess myself to myself  I find that the best virtue I have has in it some tincture of vice.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: One big vice in a man is apt to keep out a great many smaller ones.
author: Bret Harte

quote: Vice is as much a part of human nature as folly  and pornography may be as necessary to vent vice as satire is to vent folly.
author: Mavor Moore

quote: He who hates vice hates men.
author: John Morley

quote: Nurse one vice in your bosom. Give it the attention it deserves and let your virtues spring up modestly around it. Then you'll have the miser who's no liar  and the drunkard who's the benefactor of a whole city.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The vices we scoff at in others  laugh at us within ourselves.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: It is the function of vice to keep virtue within reasonable grounds.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: When our vices leave us  we flatter ourselves with the credit of having left them.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Many without punishment  none without sin.
author: John Ray

quote: If individuals have no virtues  their vices may be of use to us.
author: Junius

quote: If you don't want anyone to know it  don't do it.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: I'll habits gather by unseen degrees  As brooks make rivers  rivers run to seas.
author: John Dryden

quote: Vice can be learnt  even without a teacher.
author: Seneca

quote: There's a small choice in rotten apples.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Everyone has his faults which he continually repeats  neither fear nor shame can cure them.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: He could sell the Pope on financing a Mormon tabernacle.
author: Anonymous

quote: Some people see the cup as half empty. Some people see the cup as half full. I see the cup as too large.
author: George Carlin

quote: My mother said  "You won't amount to anything because you procrastinate." I said  "Just wait."
author: Judy Tenuta

quote: I believe in practicing prudence  at least once every two or three years.
author: Molly Ivins

quote: I don't believe in astrology -  of course  that's very typical of Leos.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: Being popular is important. Otherwise  people might not like you.
author: Mitni Pond

quote: The rich can be "eccentric " the poor have to be considered "nuts."
author: Anonymous

quote: If I only had a little humility  I'd be perfect.
author: Ted Turner

quote: The ability to sin differs among people. For example  a short-armed fisherman isn't as big a liar as a long-armed one.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. And scratch where it itches.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: You can't act like a skunk without someone's getting wind of it.
author: Lorene Workman

quote: I don't gamble. I invest with a risk.
author: Howard Crossman

quote: At home I am a nice guy  but I don't want the world to know. Humble people  I've found  don't go very far.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: I never gossip  but I can give you the names of certain people who do.
author: Judy Hampton

quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
author: Jules Renard

quote: He talks at the drop of a pause.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: Deep down I'm really shallow.
author: Linda Merkin

quote: No one can have a higher opinion of him than I have - and I think he's a dirty little beast.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Everyone is ignorant  only on different subjects.
author: Will Rogers

quote: What a pity human beings can't exchange problems. Everyone knows exactly how to solve the other fellow's.
author: Olin Miller

quote: She realizes she doesn't know as much as God but feels she knows as much as God knew when he was her age.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: The worst thing about a bore is not that he won't stop talking but that he won't let you stop listening.
author: Anonymous

quote: Horse sense is what keeps horses from betting on what people will do.
author: Raymond Nash

quote: I figure you have the same chance of winning the lottery whether you play or not.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: When compelled to cook  I produce a meal that would make a sword swallower gag.
author: Russell Baker

quote: I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: It gives me great strength to know that half the people I meet are below average.
author: Anonymous

quote: I was once thrown out of a mental hospital for depressing other patients.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: We'd all like a reputation for generosity  and we'd all like to buy it cheap.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: I may have faults  but being wrong ain't one of them.
author: Jimmy Hoffa

quote: After twelve years of therapy my psychiatrist said something that brought tears to my eyes. He said  "No bablo ingles."
author: Ronnie Shakes

quote: I'm not at all stuck up . . . although  judging from those around me  I have every right to be.
author: Anonymous

quote: Lead me not into temptation  I can find the way myself.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: I've got nothing against girls in tight sweaters - darn it!
author: Anonymous

quote: Let's just say  he has too many pigeons on his antenna.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have my standards. They may be low  but I have them.
author: Bette Midler

quote: She's not moody. She's just known for her versatility of emotions.
author: Louise Lotz

quote: Yesterday was the first day of the rest of your life . . . and you messed it up again.
author: Patrick Murray

quote: Show me someone who never gossips  and I'll show you someone who isn't interested in people.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: I always read the last page of a book first  so that if I die before I finish I'll know how it turned out.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: Well-adjusted means you can make the same mistakes over and over again  and keep smiling.
author: George Bergman

quote: When someone sings his own praises  he always gets the tune too high.
author: Mary Waldrip

quote: Everybody hates me because I'm so universally liked.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: I have too much respect for the truth to drag it out on every trifling occasion.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you  snore and you sleep alone.
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: How beautiful is victory  but how dear!
author: Anonymous

quote: Victories that are cheap are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: To the victors belong the spoils.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Who overcomes By force  hath overcome but half his foe.
author: John Milton

quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: We have met the enemy and they are ours.
author: Oliver Hazard Perry

quote: It is better to be violent  if there is violence in our hearts  than to put on the cloak of non-violence to cover impotence.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Keep violence in the mind Where it belongs.
author: Brian Aldiss

quote: Violence is the quest for identity. When identity disappears with technological innovation  violence is the natural recourse.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Violence is essentially wordless  and it can begin only where thought and rational communication have broken down.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: You know what I think about violence. For me it is profoundly moral -more moral than compromises and transactions.
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: Violence is just  where kindness is vain.
author: Corneille

quote: It is unfair to blame man too fiercely for being pugnacious  he learned the habit from Nature.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Is some cases non-violence requires more militancy than violence.
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: We are all shot through with enough motives to make a massacre  any day of the week that we want to give them their head.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: In a war of ideas it is people who get killed.
author: Stanislaw J. Lee

quote: The private terror of the liberal spirit is invariably suicide  not murder.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: Violence is  essentially  a confession of ultimate inarticulateness.
author: Time Magazine

quote: Non-violence is a powerful and just weapon. It is a weapon unique in history  which cuts without wounding and enobles the man who wields it. It is a sword that heals.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Today violence is the rhetoric of the period.
author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

quote: A tragic situation exists precisely when virtue does not triumph but when it is still felt that man is nobler than the forces which destroy him.
author: George Orwell

quote: Humility is a virtue  and it is a virtue innate in guests.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: The sun  though it passes through dirty places  yet remains as pure as before.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: There are few virtues which the Poles do not possess and there are few errors they have ever avoided.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Virtue has its own reward  but no sale at the box office.
author: Mae West

quote: When virtue has slept  she will get up more refreshed.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.
author: George Washington

quote: Purity is obscurity.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: I know myself too well to believe in pure virtue.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There are few chaste women who are not tired of their trade.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Ascetic: one who makes a necessity of virtue.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A virtue to be serviceable must  like gold  be alloyed with some commoner but more durable metal.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: The Saints are the Sinners who keep on trying.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: No doubt alcohol  tobacco  and so forth  are things that a saint must avoid  but sainthood is also a thing that human beings must avoid.
author: George Orwell

quote: If a man has no vices  he's in great danger of making vices about his virtues  and there's a spectacle.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: When men grow virtuous in their old age  they only make a sacrifice to God of the devil's leavings.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: If virtue were its own reward  it would no longer be a human quality  but supernatural.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Let him who believes in immortality enjoy his happiness in silence without giving himself airs about it.
author: Goethe

quote: One's outlook is a part of his virtue.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Virtue is like a rich stone  best plain set.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Recommend to your children virtue  that alone can make them happy  not gold.
author: Beethoven

quote: Honor is the reward of virtue.
author: Cicero

quote: I believe that Virtue shows quite as well in rags and patches as she does in purple and fine linen.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: There are those who have nothing chaste but their ears  and nothing virtuous but their tongues.
author: De Finod

quote: The only reward of virtue is virtue.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Most men admire Virtue  who follow not her lore.
author: John Milton

quote: Our virtues are most frequently but vices disguised.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Virtue is an angel  but she is a blind one  and must ask of Knowledge to show her the pathway that leads to her goal.
author: Horace Mann

quote: I prefer an accommodation vice to an obstinate virtue.
author: Moliere

quote: Virtue is health  vice is sickness.
author: Petrarch

quote: Virtue consists  not in abstaining from vice  but in not desiring it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Virtue often trips and falls on the sharp-edged rock of poverty.
author: Eugene Sue

quote: Abou Ben Adhem (may his tribe increase!) Awoke one night from a deep dream of peace  And saw  within the moonlight in his room  Making it rich  and like a lily in bloom  An angel  writing in a book of gold  Exceeding peace had made Ben Adhem bold  And to the presence in the room he said -  "What writest thou?" The Vision raised its head  And  with a look made all of sweet accord  Answered  "The names of those who love the Lord."
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Where there is no vision  the people perish.
author: Bible

quote: And it shall come to pass afterward  that I will pour out my Spirit upon all flesh  and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy  your old men shall dream dreams  your young men shall see visions.
author: Bible

quote: My thoughts by night are often filled With visions false as fair: For in the past alone  I build My castles in the air.
author: Thomas Love Peacock

quote: Before you begin a thing remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. ... You can only see one thing clearly  and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Man can only receive what he sees himself receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: A person can grow only as much as his horizon allows.
author: John Powell

quote: All prosperity begins in the mind and is dependent only upon the full use of our creative imagination.
author: Ruth Ross

quote: If we have not achieved our early dreams  we must either find new ones or see what we can salvage from the old. If we have accomplished what we set out to do in our youth  we need not weep like Alexander the Great that we have no more worlds to conquer.
author: Rosalynn Carter

quote: What man can imagine he may one day achieve.
author: Nancy Hale

quote: Envisioning the end is enough to put the means in motion.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: Our visions begin with our desires.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: It is in our idleness  in our dreams  that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: One must desire something to be alive: perhaps absolute satisfaction is only another name for Death.
author: Margaret Deland

quote: The truth isn't always beauty  but the hunger for it is.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: When your dreams tire  they go underground and out of kindness that's where they stay.
author: Libby Houston

quote: Nothing happens unless first a dream.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: The very least you can do in your life is to figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it  under its roof.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: The history of all times  and of today especially  teaches that... women will be forgotten if they forget to think about themselves.
author: Louise Otto

quote: Instead of thinking about where you are  think about where you want to be. It takes twenty years of hard work to become an overnight success.
author: Diana Rankin

quote: To the lack of incentive to effort  which is the awful shadow under which we live  may be traced the wreck and ruin of scores of colored youth.
author: Mary Church Terrell

quote: The moment of enlightenment is when a person's dreams of possibilities become images of probabilities.
author: Vic Braden

quote: Reach high  for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep  for every dream precedes the goal.
author: Pamela Vaull Starr

quote: When we can't dream any longer  we die.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: Hold fast to dreams  for if dreams die  life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: I think  at a child's birth  if a mother could ask a fairy godmother to endow it with the most useful gift  that gift should be curiosity.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: You know  my children  that humanity advances only by forming itself an ideal and endeavoring to realize it. Every passion has its ideal  which is modified by that of the whole.
author: Jenny R d'Hericourt

quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good  and we must hunger for them.
author: George Eliot

quote: The best antidote I have found is to yearn for something. As long as you yearn  you can't congeal: there is a forward motion to yearning.
author: Gail Godwin

quote: Every woman dreams of her own political career and her own place in life.
author: Raisa M. Gorbachev

quote: Dream lofty dreams  and as you dream  so shall you become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall at last unveil.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Imagination is the highest kite that can fly.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Who would ever give up the reality of dreams for relative knowledge?
author: Alice James

quote: Dreams are the sources of action  the meeting and the end  a resting place among the flight of things.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Within your heart  keep one still  secret spot where dreams may go.
author: Louise Driscoll

quote: I've dreamt in my life dreams that have stayed with me ever after  and changed my ideas: they've gone through and through me  like wine through water  and altered the color of my mind.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: It may be that those who do most  dream most.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: I've dreamt in my life dreams that have stayed with me ever after  and changed my ideas: they've gone through and through me  like wine through water  and altered the color of my mind.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: It's our dreams that keep us going  that separate us from the beasts. I wouldn't even want to live if I thought it was all just eating and sleeping and taking off my clothes.
author: Mary Chase

quote: A couple of times a day I sit quietly and visualize my body fighting the AIDS virus. It's the same as me sitting and seeing myself hit the perfect serve. I did that often when I was an athlete.
author: Arthur Ashe

quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Imagination has always had powers of resurrection that no science can match.
author: Ingrid Bengis

quote: The artist doesn't see things as they are  but as he is.
author: Anonymous

quote: Make-believe colors the past with innocent distortion  and it swirls ahead of us in a thousand ways-in science  in politics  in every bold intention. It is part of our collective lives  entwining our past and our future ... a particularly rewarding aspect of life itself.
author: Shirley Temple Black

quote: We are governed not by armies  but by ideas.
author: Mona Caird

quote: One of your most powerful inner resources is your own creativity. Be willing to try on something new and play the game full-out.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: No vision and you perish  No ideal  and you're lost  Your heart must ever cherish Some faith at any cost. Some hope  some dream to cling to  Some rainbow in the sky  Some melody to sing to  Some service that is high.
author: Harriet Du Autermont

quote: Five minutes  just before going to sleep  given to a bit of directed imagination regarding achievement possibilities of the morrow  will steadily and increasingly bear fruit  particularly if all ideas of difficulty  worry or fear are resolutely ruled out and replaced by those of accomplishment and smiling courage.
author: Frederick Pierce

quote: With our progress we have destroyed our only weapon against tedium: that rare weakness we call imagination.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: You can vitally influence your life from within by auto-suggestion. The first thing each morning  and the last thing each night  suggest to yourself specific ideas that you wish to embody in your character and personality. Address such suggestions to yourself  silently or aloud  until they are deeply impressed upon your mind.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: Leaders are visionaries with a poorly developed sense of fear and no concept of the odds against them. They make the impossible happen.
author: Dr. Robert Jarvik

quote: When there is no vision  people perish.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The voice of the people is the voice of God.
author: Hesiod

quote: The voice of one crying in the wilderness.
author: Matthew

quote: Her voice was ever soft  Gentle and low  an excellent thing in woman.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A fair day's wages for a fair day's work: it is as just a demand as governed men ever made of government.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: It is but a truism that labor is most productive where its wages are largest. Poorly paid labor is inefficient labor  the world over.
author: Henry George

quote: The laborer is worthy of his hire.
author: Bible

quote: Be content with your wages.
author: Bible

quote: The iron law of wages.
author: A. R. J. Turcot

quote: Man wants but little here below  Nor wants that little long.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Constantly choose rather to want less  than to have more.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: The stoical scheme of supplying our wants by lopping off our desires is like cutting off our feet when we want shoes.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: How few our real wants  and how vast our imaginary ones!
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: A conventional army loses if it does not win. The guerrilla wins if it does not lose.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Above all  Vietnam was a war that asked everything of a few and nothing of most in America.
author: Myra McPherson

quote: All wars are popular for the first 30 days.
author: Arthur Schlesinger

quote: Do not let us speak of darker days  let us speak rather of sterner days. These are not dark days: these are great days - the greatest days our country has ever lived.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Good things  when short  are twice as good.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: I have never understood disliking for war. It panders to instincts already catered for within the scope of any respectable domestic establishment.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: If a house be divided against itself  that house cannot stand.
author: Bible

quote: In time of war the devil makes more room in hell.
author: German proverb

quote: In war the will is directed at an animate object that reacts.
author: Karl von Clausewitz

quote: Let us not be deceived - we are today in the midst of a cold war.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Let us therefore brace ourselves to our duties  and so bear ourselves that  if the British Empire and its Commonwealth last for a thousand years  men will still say: "This was their finest hour."
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Morality is contraband in war.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Scots  wha hae wi' Wallace bled  Scots  wham Bruce has aften led  Welcome to your gory bed Or to victorie.
author: Robert Burns

quote: So long as the anti-militarists propose no substitute for war's disciplinary function  no moral equivalent of war  analogous  as one might say  to the mechanical equivalent of hate  so long they fail to realize the full equities of the situation.
author: William James

quote: Television brought the brutality of war into the comfort of the living room. Vietnam was lost in the living rooms of U.S.A. - not on the battlefields of Vietnam.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
author: George Orwell

quote: There never was a good war or a bad peace.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: They will conquer  but they will not convince.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: We few  we happy few  we band of brothers  For he today that sheds his blood with me  Shall be my brother.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Tweedle Dum and Tweedle Dee Agreed to have a battle  For Tweedle Dum said Tweedle Dee Had spoiled his nice new rattle.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: We shall not flag or fail. We shall fight in France  we shall fight on the seas and oceans  we shall fight with growing confidence and growing strength in the air  we shall defend our island  whatever the cost may be  we shall fight on the beaches  we shall fight on the landing grounds  we shall fight in the fields and in the streets  we shall fight in the hills  we shall never surrender.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: When the rich wage war  it's the poor who die.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: We only win at war because we fight another government. If we fought private industry we would not last until noontime.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: War is much too important a matter to be left to the generals.
author: Georges Clemenceau

quote: War is mainly a catalogue of blunders.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: War is a series of catastrophes which result in victory.
author: Georges Clemenceau

quote: It would indeed be a tragedy if the history of the human race proved to be nothing more than the story of an ape playing with a box of matches on a petrol dump.
author: David Ormsby Gore

quote: Either war is obsolete  or men are.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: War appeals to young men because it is fundamentally auto-eroticism.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Wars are not fought for territory  but for words. Man's deadliest weapon is language. He is as susceptible to being hypnotized by slogans as he is to infectious diseases. And where there is an epidemic  the group-mind takes over.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: A war regarded as inevitable or even probable  and therefore much prepared for  has a very good chance of eventually being fought.
author: Anais Nin

quote: War is the unfolding of miscalculations.
author: Barbara Tuchman

quote: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Today the real test of power is not capacity to make war but capacity to prevent it.
author: Anne O'Hare McCormick

quote: As long as war is regarded as wicked  it will always have its fascination. When it is looked upon as vulgar  it will cease to be popular.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: What the hell difference does it make  left or right? There were good men lost on both sides.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The supreme excellence is not to win a hundred victories in a hundred battles. The supreme excellence is to subdue the armies of your enemies without even having to fight them.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Frankly I'd like to see the government get out of war altogether and leave the whole field to private industry.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: War is the national industry of Prussia.
author: Mirabeau

quote: It is a fearful thing to lead this great peaceful people into war  into the most terrible and disastrous of all wars  civilization itself seeming to be in the balance. But the right is more precious than peace  and we shall fight for the things which we have always carried nearest our hearts - for democracy.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Sweet is war to those who have never experienced it.
author: Latin proverb

quote: The possibility of war increases in direct proportion to the effectiveness of the instruments of war.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: I don't know what effect these men will have on the enemy  but by God  they frighten me.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: Boys are the cash of war. Whoever said: we're not free spenders- doesn't know our like.
author: John Ciardi

quote: In time of war the first casualty is truth.
author: Boake Carter

quote: World War II was the last government program that really worked.
author: George Will

quote: It's one of the most serious things that can possibly happen to one in a battle - to get one's head cut off.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: No one can guarantee success in war  but only deserve it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There is no such thing as inevitable war. If war comes it will be from failure of human wisdom.
author: Bonar Law

quote: The world will never have lasting peace so long as men reserve for war the finest human qualities.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: War would end if the dead could return.
author: Stanley Baldwin

quote: If they want peace  nations should avoid the pinpricks that precede cannon shots.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: A man who experiences no genuine satisfaction in life does not want peace. People court war to escape meaninglessness and boredom  to be relieved of fear and frustration.
author: Nels F. S. Ferre

quote: The object of war is to survive it.
author: John Irving

quote: So far war has been the only force that can discipline a whole community  and until an equivalent discipline is organized  I believe that war must have its way.
author: William James

quote: Men love war because it allows them to look serious  because it is the only thing that stops women laughing at them.
author: John Fowles

quote: War hath no fury like a non-combatant.
author: E. C. Montague

quote: Most sorts of diversion in men  children and other animals  are in imitation of fighting.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Nothing except a battle lost can be half so melancholy as a battle won.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: Human war has been the most successful of all our cultural traditions.
author: Robert Ardrey

quote: War is the trade of kings.
author: John Dryden

quote: The whole art of war consists of guessing at what is on the other side of the hill.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: It is well that war is so terrible - we would grow too fond of it.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Men grow tired of sleep  love  singing and dancing sooner than of war.
author: Homer

quote: Most people coming out of war feel lost and resentful. What had been a minute-to-minute confrontation with yourself  your struggle with what courage you have against discomfort  at the least  and death at the other end  ties you to the people you have known in the war and makes for a time others seem alien and frivolous.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Vice stirs up war  virtue fights.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: In peace  sons bury their fathers  in war  fathers bury their sons.
author: Herodotus

quote: War will exist until that distant day when the conscientious objector enjoys the same reputation and prestige that the warrior does today.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The weak against the strong  Is always in the wrong.
author: Ivan Krylov

quote: But  in case signals can neither be seen or perfectly understood  no captain can do very wrong if he places his ship alongside the enemy.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: Something must be left to chance  nothing is sure in a sea fight beyond all others.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: War is like love  it always finds a way.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: The guerilla must live amongst the people as the fish lives in the water.
author: Mao Tse-Tung

quote: It simply is not true that war never settles anything.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: War does not determine who is right - only who is left.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are no atheists in the foxholes.
author: William Thomas Cummings

quote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory  but boys  it is all hell.
author: William T. Sherman

quote: There will be no veterans of World War III.
author: Walter Mondale

quote: War is the science of destruction.
author: John S. C. Abbott

quote: The inevitableness  the idealism  and the blessing of war  as an indispensable and stimulating law of development  must be repeatedly emphasized.
author: Anonymous

quote: Great Britain was going to make war on a kindred nation who desired nothing better than to be friends with her.
author: Theobald von Bethmann-Hollweg

quote: Better pointed bullets than pointed speeches.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: War never leaves  where it found a nation.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Veni  vidi  vici. (I came  I saw  I conquered.)
author: Julius Caesar

quote: (The great questions of the day) are not decided by speeches and majority votes  but by blood and iron.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: What millions died - that Caesar might be great!
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: What distinguishes war is  not that man is slain  but that he is slain  spoiled  crushed by the cruelty  the injustice  the treachery  the murderous hand of man.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: General Taylor never surrenders.
author: Thomas L. Crittenden

quote: We give up the fort when there's not a man left to defend it.
author: General Croghan

quote: War  he sung  is toil and trouble  Honour but an empty bubble.
author: John Dryden

quote: By the rude bridge that arched the flood  Their flag to April's breeze unfurl'd  Here once the embattl'd farmers stood  And fired the shot heard round the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There never was a good war or a bad peace.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Hang yourself  brave Crillon. We fought at Arques  and you were not there.
author: Henry IV

quote: It is not right to exult over slain men.
author: Homer

quote: War is as much a punishment to the punisher as to the sufferer.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Mine eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord: He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored: He hath loosed the fateful lightning of his terrible swift sword: His truth is marching on.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: We don't want to fight  but by jingo if we do  We've got the ships  we've got the men  we've got the money too. We've fought the Bear before and while we're Britons true  The Russians shall not have Constantinople.
author: G. W. Hunt

quote: I have prayed in her fields of poppies  I have laughed with the men who died -  But in all my ways and through all my days Like a friend He walked beside. I have seen a sight under Heaven That only God understands  In the battle's glare I have seen Christ there With the Sword of God in His hand.
author: Gordon Johnstone

quote: Modern warfare is an intricate business about which no one knows everything and few know very much.
author: Frank Knox

quote: There is no such thing as an inevitable war. If war comes it will be from failure of human wisdom.
author: Bonar Law

quote: 0 God assist our side: at least  avoid assisting the enemy and leave the rest to me.
author: Prince Leopold

quote: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: To arms! to arms! ye brave! The avenging sword unsheathe  March on! march on! all hearts resolved On victory or death!
author: Rouget de Lisle

quote: Ez for war  I call it murder  -  There you hev it plain and flat  I don't want to go no furder Than my Testyment for that.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: War is the greatest plague that can afflict humanity  it destroys religion  it destroys states  it destroys families. Any scourge is preferable to it.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Take up our quarrel with the foe! To you from failing hands we throw The torch  be yours to hold it high. If ye break faith with us who die We shall not sleep  though poppies grow In Flanders' fields.
author: John McCrae

quote: War hath no fury like a noncombatant.
author: C. E. Montague

quote: Wars and rumours of wars.
author: Matthew

quote: And this I hate - not men  nor flag nor race  But only War with its wild  grinning face.
author: Joseph Dana Miler

quote: When after many battles past  Both tir'd with blows  make peace at last  What is it  after all  the people get? Why! taxes  widows  wooden legs  and debt.
author: Francis Moore

quote: The brazen throat of war.
author: John Milton

quote: God how the dead men Grin by the wall  Watching the fun Of the Victory Ball.
author: Alfred Noyes

quote: O war! thou son of Hell!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A bad peace is even worse than war.
author: Tacitus

quote: As long as war is regarded as wicked  it will always have its fascination. When it is looked upon as vulgar  it will cease to be popular.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The father of his country.
author: Francis Bailey

quote: He that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
author: Bible

quote: I glory more in the coming purchase of my wealth than in the glad possession.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: I'll fares the land  to hastening ills of prey Where wealth accumulates  and men decay.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: It is the wretchedness of being rich that you have to live with rich people.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: One cannot both feast and become rich.
author: Ashanti proverb

quote: Poor men seek meat for their stomach  rich men stomach for their meat.
author: Old saying

quote: Riches serve a wise man but command a fool.
author: Old saying

quote: The first wealth is health.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The smell of profit is clean and sweet  whatever the source.
author: Juvenal

quote: There are few sorrows  however poignant  in which a good income is of no avail.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: The human race has had long experience and a fine tradition in surviving adversity. But we now face a task for which we have little experience  the task of surviving prosperity.
author: Alan Gregg

quote: Riches enlarge  rather than satisfy appetites.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Australia is so kind that  just tickle her with a hoe  and she laughs with a harvest.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: It is better to live rich than to die rich.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: We can have democracy in this country or we can have great wealth concentrated in the hands of a few  but we can't have both.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: I am opposed to millionaires  but it would be dangerous to offer me the position.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Sleep  riches and health to be truly enjoyed must be interrupted.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: The wealth of a nation consists not in its mass of material things  but in its system. The natural resources of South America are not inferior to those of the United States  but the wealth of the two regions is vastly different. The land of India is far richer than that of Japan  but the comparative wealth of the two nations is reversed.
author: George Brockway

quote: I have enough money to get by. I'm not independently wealthy  just independently lazy  I suppose.
author: Montgomery Clift

quote: I have no complex about wealth. I have worked hard for my money  producing things people need. I believe that the able industrial leader who creates wealth and employment is more worthy of historical notice than politicians or soldiers.
author: Paul Getty

quote: I was born into it and there was nothing I could do about it. It was there  like air or food  or any other element. The only question with wealth is what you do with it.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Riches do not consist in the possession of treasures  but in the use made of them.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: I wish to become rich  so that I can instruct the people and glorify honest poverty a little  like those kind-hearted  fat  benevolent people do.
author: Mark Twain

quote: In big houses in which things are done properly  there is always the religious element. The diurnal cycle is observed with more feeling when there are servants to do the work.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: True abundance is not about gathering more things  it's about touching the place in us that is connected to the divine source of abundance  so that we know what we need in the moment will be provided.
author: Mary Manin Morrissey

quote: It's time we put thoughts of lack behind us. It's time for us to discover the secrets of the stars  to sail to an uncharted land  to open up a new heaven where our spirits can soar.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: It is good to have things that money can buy  but it is also good to check up once in awhile and be sure we have the things money can't buy.
author: George Horace Lorimer

quote: Ordinary riches can be stolen  real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: 'Let us not get so busy or live so fast that we can't listen to the music of the meadow or the symphony that glorifies the forest. Some things in the world are far more important than wealth  one of them is the ability to enjoy simple things.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It is wealth to be content.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Who is rich? He that rejoices in his portion.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If you're happy  you're wealthy! Happiness doesn't need a bank account.
author: Sr. Mary Christelle Macaluso

quote: Wealth ... is a relative thing since he that has little and wants less is richer than he that has much but wants more.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sometimes when you have everything  you can't really tell what matters.
author: Christina Onassis

quote: The only question with wealth is what you do with it.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: The rich man is not one who is in possession of much  but one who gives much.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Having given all he had  He then is very rich indeed.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: If you see yourself as prosperous  you will be. If you see yourself as continually hard up  that is exactly what you will be.
author: Robert Collier

quote: Prosperity is just around the corner.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Wealth is not his that has it  but his who enjoys it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I have mental joys and mental health  Mental friends and mental wealth  I've a wife that I love and that loves me  I've all but riches bodily.
author: William Blake

quote: Surplus wealth is a sacred trust which its possessor is bound to administer in his life-time for the good of the community.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: If you would be wealthy  think of saving as well as of getting.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The ideal social state is not that in which each gets an equal amount of wealth  but in which each gets in proportion to his contribution to the general stock.
author: Henry George

quote: I'll fares the land  to hastening ills a prey  Where wealth accumulates  and men decay  Princes and Lords may flourish  or may fade -  A breath can make them  as a breath has made -  But a bold peasantry  their country's pride  When once destroy'd can never be supplied.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Riches either serve or govern the possessor.
author: Horace

quote: The wealth of nations is men  not silk and cotton and gold.
author: Richard Hovey

quote: Life is short. The sooner that a man begins to enjoy his wealth the better.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Our Lord commonly giveth Riches to such gross asses  to whom he affordeth nothing else that is good.
author: Martin Luther

quote: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle  than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
author: Matthew

quote: I am rich beyond the dreams of avarice.
author: Edward Moore

quote: All wealth is the product of labor
author: John Locke

quote: Get place and wealth  if possible  with grace  If not  by any means get wealth and place.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Riches certainly make themselves wings.
author: Proverbs

quote: He that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
author: Proverbs

quote: He heapeth up riches  and knoweth not who shall gather them.
author: Bible

quote: No good man ever became suddenly rich.
author: Syrus

quote: Can snore upon the flint  when resty sloth Finds the down pillow hard.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: One of the most adventurous things left is to go to bed  for no one can lay a hand on our dreams.
author: E. V. Lucas

quote: Sleeping is no mean art. For its sake one must stay awake all day.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Sleep faster  we need the pillows.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: That we are not much sicker and much madder than we are is due exclusively to that most blessed and blessing of all natural graces  sleep.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I never sleep in comfort save when I am hearing a sermon or praying to God.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Sleep - kinsman thou to death and trance and madness.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Thou hast been called  O sleep! the friend of woe  But 'tis the happy who have called thee so.
author: Robert Southey

quote: Yet a little sleep  a little slumber  a little folding of the hands to sleep.
author: Bible

quote: Sleep takes off the costume of circumstance  arms us with terrible freedom  so that every will rushes to deed. A skillful man reads his dreams for his self-knowledge  yet not the details  but the quality. What part does he play in them - a cheerful  manly part  or a poor  drivelling part? However monstrous and grotesque their apparitions  they have a substantial truth.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: For some must watch  while some must sleep  thus runs the world away.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: As a rule man is a fool  When it's hot he wants it cool  When it's cool he wants it hot  Always wanting what is not.
author: Anonymous

quote: Change of weather is the discourse of fools.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I was born with a chronic anxiety about the weather.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Fair weather cometh out of the north.
author: Bible

quote: Oh  what a blamed uncertain thing This pesky weather is  It blew and snew and then it thew  And now  by jing  it's friz.
author: Philander Johnson

quote: When two Englishmen meet  their first talk is of the weather.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Tis sweet to hear the watchdog's honest bark Bay deep-mouth'd welcome as we draw near home.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Come in the evening  come in the morning  Come when expected  come without warning  Thousands of welcomes you'll find here before you  And the oftener you come  the more we'll adore you.
author: Irish Rhyme

quote: Welcome as the flowers in May.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Westward the course of empire takes its way.
author: Bishop Berkeley

quote: Out where the handclasp's a little stronger  Out where the smile dwells a little longer  That's where the West begins.
author: Arthur Chapman

quote: Go West  young man  and grow up with the country.
author: Horace Greeley

quote: Westward  Ho!
author: George Peele

quote: The weakest and most timorous are the most revengeful and implacable.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: When a man's willing and eager  God joins in.
author: Aeschylus

quote: April is the crudest month  breeding Lilacs out of the dead land  mixing Memory and desire  stirring Dull roots with spring rain.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Man is worse than an animal when he is an animal.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Men are always wicked at bottom unless they are made good by some compulsion.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: God bears with the wicked  but not forever.
author: Cervantes

quote: Weak men are apt to be cruel because they stick at nothing that may repair the ill effect of their mistakes.
author: George, Lord Halifax

quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

quote: I must be cruel Only to be kind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: We are oftener treacherous through weakness than through calculation.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: When we do evil  We and our victims Are equally bewildered.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Half of the harm that is done in this world Is due to people who want to feel important. They don't mean to do harm - but the harm does not interest them.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: We all have flaws  and mine is being wicked.
author: James Thurber

quote: Why inflict pain on oneself  when so many others are ready to save us the trouble?
author: George W. Pacaud

quote: God bears with the wicked  but not forever.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: No man ever became very wicked all at once.
author: Juvenal

quote: The world loves a spice of wickedness.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Wickedness is weakness.
author: John Milton

quote: The wicked flee when no man pursueth  but the righteous are bold as a lion.
author: Proverbs

quote: The sun also shines on the wicked.
author: Seneca

quote: 'Cause I's wicked  - I is. I's mighty wicked  anyhow  I can't help it.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Wives are young men's mistresses  companions for middle age  and old men's nurses.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: She is a winsome wee thing  She is a handsome wee thing  She is a bonny wee thing  This sweet wee wife o' mine.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Think you  if Laura had been Petrarch's wife  He would have written sonnets all his life?
author: Lord Byron

quote: In every mess I find a friend  In every port a wife.
author: Charles Dibdin

quote: An undutiful Daughter will prove an unmanageable Wife.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He knows little who will tell his wife all he knows.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A miss for pleasure  and a wife for breed.
author: John Gay

quote: Alas! another instance of the triumph of hope over experience.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: All other goods by fortune's hand are given: A wife is the peculiar gift of Heav'n.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: She looketh well to the ways of her household  and eateth not the bread of idleness.
author: Proverbs

quote: It is a woman's business to get married as soon as possible  and a man's to keep unmarried as long as he can.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: My dear  my better half.
author: Philip Sidney

quote: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them and know it  but do not dare confess it to themselves.
author: Anonymous

quote: Nothing and no one can destroy the Chinese people. They are relentless survivors.
author: Pearl Buck

quote: Nothing is easy to the unwilling.
author: Thomas Fuller
