quote: Success depends in a very large measure upon individual initiative and exertion  and cannot be achieved except by a dint of hard work.
author: Anna Pavlova

quote: Nothing worthwhile comes easily. Half effort does not produce half results  it produces no results. Work  continuous work and hard work  is the only way to accomplish results that last.
author: Hamilton Holt

quote: If a man wakes up famous  he hasn't been sleeping.
author: Wes Izzard

quote: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
author: David Bly

quote: If your dream is a big dream  and if you want your life to work on the high level that you say you do  there's no way around doing the work it takes to get you there.
author: Joyce Chapman

quote: Success is dependent on effort.
author: Sophocles

quote: Hard work has made it easy. That is my secret. That is why I win.
author: Nadia Comaneci

quote: Success comes before work only in the dictionary.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sweat plus sacrifice equals success.
author: Charles O. Finley

quote: The only thing that separates successful people from the ones who aren't is the willingness to work very  very hard.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: You can have unbelievable intelligence  you can have connections  you can have opportunities fall out of the sky. But in the end  hard work is the true  enduring characteristic of successful people.
author: Marsha Evans

quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: In all human affairs there are efforts  there are results  and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: Work  alternated with needful rest  is the salvation of man or woman.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: There is a time for work. And a time for love. That leaves no other time.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Neither woman nor man lives by work  or love  alone.... The human self defines itself and grows through love and work: All psychology before and after Freud boils down to that.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Maintain a good balance. A personal life adds dimensions to your professional life and vice versa. It helps nurture creativity through a deeper understanding of yourself.
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: For the happiest life  days should be rigorously planned  nights left open to chance.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Work is the province of cattle.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: The only sin passion can commit is to be joyless.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Skilled labor teaches something not to be found in books or in colleges.
author: Laura Towne

quote: Diligence is the mother of good luck  and God gives all things to industry.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: To industry  nothing is impossible.
author: Latin proverb

quote: I believe in hard work. It keeps the wrinkles out of the mind and spirit.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quote: God sells us all things at the price of labor.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The sport I love has taken me around the world and shown me many things.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: I realized that with hard work  the world was your oyster. You could do anything you wanted to do. I learned that at a young age.
author: Chris Evert

quote: Fortune is ever seen accompanying industry.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Manual labor to my father was not only good and decent for its own sake  but as he was given to saying  it straightened out one's thoughts.
author: Mary Ellen Chase

quote: I get satisfaction of three kinds. One is creating something  one is being paid for it and one is the feeling that I haven't just been sitting on my ass all afternoon.
author: William F. Buckley

quote: The sentimentalist ages far more quickly than the person who loves his work and enjoys new challenges.
author: Lillie Langtry

quote: Busy people are never busybodies.
author: Ethel Watts Mumford

quote: What a man sows  that shall he and his relations reap.
author: Clarissa Graves

quote: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
author: Ginger Rogers

quote: I have worked all my life  wanted to work all my life  needed to work all my life.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: The simple idea that everyone needs a reasonable amount of challenging work in his or her life  and also a personal life  complete with noncompetitive leisure  has never really taken hold.
author: Judith Martin

quote: There is no more dreadful punishment than futile and hopeless labor.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Whether we call it a job or a career  work is more than just something we do. It is a part of who we are.
author: Anita Hill

quote: If I could I would always work in silence and obscurity  and let my efforts be known by their results.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Nobody ever drowned in his own sweat.
author: Ann Landers

quote: The heights by great men reached and kept Were not attained by sudden flight  But they  while their companions slept  Were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Work in some form or other is the appointed lot of all.
author: Anna Jameson

quote: Any man who has had the job I've had and didn't have a sense of humor wouldn't still be here.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Whatever the job you are asked to do at whatever level  do a good job because your reputation is your resume.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: People should tell their children what life is all about-it's about work.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Marriage ain't easy but nothing that's worth much ever is.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: I don't think that work ever really destroyed anybody. I think that lack of work destroys them a hell of a lot more.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: For the last third of life there remains only work. It alone is always stimulating  rejuvenating  exciting and satisfying.
author: Kathe Kollwitz

quote: I slept  and dreamed that life was Beauty  I woke  and found that life was Duty.
author: Ellen Sturgis Hooper

quote: Passion is never enough  neither is skill.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: It's not the having  it's the getting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls  and looks like work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: A man's work is from sun to sun  but a mother's work is never done.
author: Anonymous

quote: Be strong! We are not here to play  to dream  to drift  We have hard work to do and loads to lift  Shun not the struggle-face it  'tis God's gift.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: If you could once make up your mind never to undertake more work ... than you can carry on calmly  quietly  without hurry or flurry ... and if the instant you feel yourself growing nervous and ... out of breath  you would stop and take a breath  you would find this simple common-sense rule doing for you what no prayers or tears could ever accomplish.
author: Elizabeth Prentiss

quote: It is better to have no emotion when it is work. Do what needs to be done  and do it coolly.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic  conquering spirit  we get things done.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously  and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative  and the second is disastrous.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Work is the best method devised for killing time.
author: William Feather

quote: Industry is a better horse to ride than genius.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: There are two kinds of talents  man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent you have to work very hard. With God-given talent  you just touch it up once in a while.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: If you want something done  ask a busy person to do it. The more things you do  the more you can do.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: With the power of conviction  there is no sacrifice.
author: Pat Benatar

quote: I believe you are your work. Don't trade the stuff of your life  time  for nothing more than dollars. That's a rotten bargain
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: When you're following your energy and doing what you want all the time  the distinction between work and play dissolves.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: Work is the thing that stays. Work is the thing that sees us through.
author: Ellen Gilchrist

quote: Energy is the power that drives every human being. It is not lost by exertion but maintained by it  for it is a faculty of the psyche.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: It is not hard work that is dreary  it is superficial work
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: As for me  prizes mean nothing. My prize is my work.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: There can be no substitute for work  neither affection nor physical well-being can replace it.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Work is its own cure. You have to like it better than being loved.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Work ... has always been my favorite form of recreation.
author: Anna Howard Shaw

quote: A job is not a career. I think I started out with a job. It turned into a career and changed my life.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: The only genius that's worth anything is the genius for hard work.
author: Kathleen Winsor

quote: Elbow grease is the best polish.
author: English proverb

quote: Never despair  but if you do  work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Laziness is a secret ingredient that goes into failure. But it's only kept a secret from the person who fails.
author: Robert Half

quote: Pears cannot ripen alone. So we ripened together.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: Ideally  couples need three lives  one for him  one for her  and one for them together.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: Exchange is creation.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Whatever my individual desires were to be free  I was not alone. There were others who felt the same way.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Now men and women are separate and unequal. We should be hand in hand  in fact  we should have our arms around one another.
author: Cloris Leachman

quote: Men and women are like right and left hands: it doesn't make sense not to use both.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: There are three ways of dealing with difference: domination  compromise  and integration. By domination only one side gets what it wants  by compromise neither side gets what it wants  by integration we find a way by which both sides may get what they wish.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: Women and men have to fight together to change society-and both will benefit.
author: Muriel Fox

quote: Every time a man unburdens his heart to a stranger he reaffirms the love that unites humanity.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee  and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Cooperation is an intelligent functioning of the concept of laissez faire-a thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
author: Virginia Burden Tower

quote: Most leaders are indispensable  but to produce a major social change  many ordinary people must also be involved.
author: Anne Firor Scott

quote: Communication is a continual balancing act  juggling the conflicting needs for intimacy and independence. To survive in the world  we have to act in concert with others  but to survive as ourselves  rather than simply as cogs in a wheel  we have to act alone.
author: Deborah Tannen

quote: My whole life  whether it be long or short  shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong. But I shall not have the strength to carry out this resolution alone unless you join in it with me.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

quote: A person who believes ... that there is a whole of which one is a part  and that in being a part one is whole: such a person has no desire whatever  at any time  to play God. Only those who have denied their being yearn to play at it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: Unless I am a part of everything I am nothing.
author: Penelope Lively

quote: For what is done or learned by one class of women becomes  by virtue of their common womanhood  the property of all women.
author: Elizabeth Blackwell

quote: We learn best to listen to our own voices if we are listening at the same time to other women-whose stories  for all our differences  turn out  if we listen well  to be our stories also.
author: Barbara Deming

quote: Remember the dignity of your womanhood. Do not appeal  do not beg  do not grovel. Take courage  join hands  stand beside us  fight with us.
author: Christabel Pankhurst

quote: Today whenever women gather together it is not necessarily nurturing. It is coalition building. And if you feel the strain  you may be doing some good work.
author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

quote: Women's art  though created in solitude  wells up out of community. There is  clearly  both enormous hunger for the work thus being diffused  and an explosion of creative energy  bursting through the coercive choicelessness of the system on whose boundaries we are working.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: You've got to be willing to stay committed to someone over the long run  and sometimes it doesn't work out. But often if you become real honest with yourself and honest with each other  and put aside whatever personal hurt and disappointment you have to really understand yourself and your spouse  it can be the most wonderful experience you've ever had.
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quote: We must stand together  if we don't  there will be no victory for any one of us.
author: Mother Jones

quote: I've always believed that one woman's success can only help another woman's success.
author: Gloria Vanderbilt

quote: Alone we can do so little  together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I always feel the movement is a sort of mosaic. Each of us puts in one little stone  and then you get a great mosaic at the end.
author: Alice Paul

quote: We all act as hinges-fortuitous links between other people.
author: Penelope Lively

quote: We seldom stop to think how many people's lives are entwined with our own. It is a form of selfishness to imagine that every individual can operate on his own or can pull out of the general stream and not be missed.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: When Adam dolve  and Eve span  Who was then the gentleman?
author: John Ball

quote: Better to wear out than to rust out.
author: Bishop Cumberland

quote: The workers are the saviors of society  the redeemers of the race.
author: Eugene V. Debs

quote: Handle your tools without mittens.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tools were made and born were hands  Every farmer understands.
author: William Blake

quote: I never did anything worth doing by accident  nor did any of my inventions come by accident  they came by work.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

quote: It's all in the day's work.
author: English Saying

quote: A ploughman on his legs is higher than a gentleman on his knees.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread.
author: Bible

quote: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
author: James Howell

quote: I like work  it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours. I love to keep it by me: the idea of getting rid of it nearly breaks my heart.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: And only the Master shall praise us  and only the Master shall blame  And no one shall work for money  and no one shall work for fame  But each for the joy of the working  and each  in his separate star  Shall draw the Thing as he sees It  for the God of things as They Are!
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: No man is born into the world whose work Is not born with him  there is always work  And tools to work withal  for those who will  And blessed are the horny hands of toil!
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The laborer is worthy of his hire.
author: Bible

quote: How many a rustic Milton has passed by  Stifling the speechless longings of his heart  In unremitting drudgery and care! How many a vulgar Cato has compelled His energies  no longer tameless then  To mould a pin  or fabricate a nail!
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Many hands make light work.
author: William Patten

quote: Heaven is blessed with perfect rest but the blessing of earth is toil.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: This is the best world  that we live in  To lend and to spend and to give in: But to borrow  or beg  or to get a man's own  It is the worst world that ever was known.
author: Anonymous

quote: This world's a bubble.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Believe everything you hear said of the world  nothing is too impossibly bad.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The world is like a board with holes in it  and the square men have got into the round holes  and the round into the square.
author: Bishop Berkeley

quote: The pomps and vanity of this wicked world.
author: Bible

quote: But in this world nothing is sure but death and taxes.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The year's at the Spring And day's at the morn  Morning's at seven  The hillside's dew-pearled  The lark's on the wing  The snail's on the thorn: God's in his Heaven -  All's right with the world!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I have not loved the world  nor the world me  I have not flatter'd its rank breath  nor bow'd To its idolatries a patient knee.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Socrates  indeed  when he was asked of what country he called himself  said  "Of the world"  for he considered himself an inhabitant and a citizen of the whole world.
author: Cicero

quote: Such stuff the world is made of.
author: William Cowper

quote: Come  follow me  and leave the world to its babblings.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Good-bye  proud world! I'm going home  Thou are not my friend  I am not thine.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: But it does move.
author: Galileo

quote: The world is a beautiful book  but of little use to him who cannot read it.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: The nations are as a drop of a bucket.
author: Isaiah

quote: World without end.
author: Isaiah

quote: It takes all sorts of people to make a world.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: If there is one beast in all the loathsome fauna of civilization I hate and despise it is a man of the world.
author: Henry Arthur Jones

quote: The world is God's world  after all.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: The world goes up and the world goes down  And the sunshine follows the rain  And yesterday's sneer and yesterday's frown Can never come over again  Sweet wife. No  never come over again.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: You'll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If all the world must see the world As the world the world hath seen  Then it were better for the world That the world had never been.
author: Charles C. Leland

quote: The world is full of beauty  as other worlds above  And if we did our duty  it might be as full of love.
author: Gerald Massey

quote: This world is all a fleeting show  For man's illusion given  The smiles of joy  the tears of woe  Deceitful shine  deceitful flow  -  There's nothing true but Heaven.
author: George Moore

quote: Half the world does not know how the other half lives.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: All the world's a stage  And all the men and women merely players.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Why  then  the world's mine oyster  Which I with sword will open.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: This world surely is wide enough to hold both thee and me.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: There was all the world and his wife.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: A mad world  my masters.
author: John Taylor

quote: So many worlds  so much to do  So little done  such things to be.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Everything is for the best in this best of all possible worlds.
author: Voltaire

quote: This world is a comedy to those who think  a tragedy to those who feel.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Worry affects the circulation  the heart  the glands  the whole nervous system  and profoundly affects the health. You have never known a man who died from overwork  but many who died from doubt.
author: Charles W. Mayo

quote: Everybody knows if you are too careful you are so occupied in being careful that you are sure to stumble over something.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Worry is a god  invisible but omnipotent. It steals the bloom from the cheek and lightness from the pulse  it takes away the appetite  and turns the hair gray.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A worried man could borrow a lot of trouble with practically no collateral.
author: Helen Nielsen

quote: If your eyes are blinded with your worries  you cannot see the beauty of the sunset.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: If you worry about what might be  and wonder what might have been  you will ignore what is.
author: Anonymous

quote: Bacteria and other microorganisms find it easier to infect people who worry and fret.
author: Leo Rangell

quote: Worry is a funky luxury when a lot has to be done.
author: Melvin Peebles

quote: Worries are the most stubborn habits in the world. Even after a poor man has won a huge lottery prize  he will still for months wake up in the night with a start  worrying about food and rent.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: There is nothing so wretched or foolish as to anticipate misfortunes. What madness is it in expecting evil before it arrives?
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Worry is like racing the engine of an automobile without letting in the clutch.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Worry is evidence of an ill-controlled brain  it is merely a stupid waste of time in unpleasantness.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: It ain't no use putting up your umbrella till it rains!
author: Alice Caldwell Rice

quote: When speculation has done its worst  two and two still make four.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Worry a little bit every day and in a lifetime you will lose a couple of years. If something is wrong  fix it if you can. But train yourself not to worry. Worry never fixes anything.
author: Mary Hemingway

quote: Worry is like a rocking chair-it keeps you moving but doesn't get you anywhere.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Anxiety is the poison of human life  the parent of many sins and of more miseries.... Can it alter the cause  or unravel the mystery of human events?
author: Paxton Blair

quote: It only seems as if you are doing something when you're worrying.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: A hundredload of worry will not pay an ounce of debt.
author: George Herbert

quote: Worry is a futile thing  it's somewhat like a rocking chair  Although is keeps you occupied  it doesn't get you anywhere.
author: Anonymous

quote: Worry never climbed a hill  worry never paid a bill  Worry never dried a tear  worry never calmed a fear  Worry never darned a heel  worry never cooked a meal  It never led a horse to water  nor ever did a thing it "oughter."
author: Anonymous

quote: I am reminded of the advice of my neighbor. "Never worry about your heart 'til it stops beating."
author: E. B. White

quote: Worry is as useless as a handle on a snowball.
author: Mitzi Chandler

quote: When you worry  you go over the same ground endlessly and come out the same place you started. Thinking  on the other hand  makes progress from one place to another. ... The problem of life is to change worry into thinking  and anxiety into creative action.
author: Harold B. Walker

quote: Which of you by being anxious can add one cubit unto his stature?
author: Bible

quote: I think these difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way  and that so many things that one goes around worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: You always get negative reactions. If you worry about that  you would never do anything.
author: Tom Monaghan

quote: Anxiety never yet successfully bridged any chasm.
author: Giovanni Ruffini

quote: Cast away care  he that loves sorrow lengthens not a day  nor can he buy tomorrow.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: Worry doesn't help tomorrow's troubles  but it does ruin today's happiness.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can't start worrying about what's going to happen. You get spastic enough worrying about what's happening now.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: There are two days in the week about which and upon which I never worry. ... One of these days is Yesterday ... And the other day I do not worry about is Tomorrow.
author: Robert Jones Burdette

quote: We have to fight them daily  like fleas  those many small worries about the morrow  for they sap our energies.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: T'ain't worthwhile to wear a day all out before it comes.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow  but only saps today of its strength.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it!
author: Doris Day

quote: Be  therefore  not anxious about tomorrow  for tomorrow will be anxious for the things of itself.
author: Bible

quote: Never despair  but if you do  work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: If you are doing your best  you will not have time to worry about failure.
author: Robert Hillyer

quote: It is not work that kills men  it is worry. Work is healthy  you can hardly put more upon a man that he can bear. Worry is rust upon the blade.
author: Henry Ward Hughes

quote: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a day of work.
author: John Lubbock

quote: The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Worry is a form of fear.
author: Bertrand A. Russell

quote: Worry is a complete cycle of inefficient thought revolving about a pivotal fear.
author: Anonymous

quote: Worry is a state of mind based on fear.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Worry is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
author: Arthur Somers Roche

quote: If we would keep filling our minds with the picture of happy things ahead  many worries and anxieties  and perhaps ill health  would naturally melt away.... Always expect the best. Then if you have to hurdle a few tough problems  you will have generated the strength and courage to do so.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Turn resolutely to work  to recreation  or in any case to physical exercise till you are so tired you can't help going to sleep  and when you wake up you won't want to worry.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: A great many worries can be diminished by realizing the unimportance of the matter which is causing anxiety.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A problem not worth praying about is not worth worrying about.
author: Anonymous

quote: We can always get along better by reason and love of truth than by worry of conscience and remorse. Harmful are these  and evil.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: As a cure for worrying  work is better than whiskey.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Every morning I spend fifteen minutes filling my mind full of God  and so there's no room left for worry thoughts.
author: Howard Chandler Christy

quote: Worry compounds the futility of being trapped on a dead-end street. Thinking opens new avenues.
author: Cullen Hightower

quote: Rule No. i is  don't sweat the small stuff. Rule No. 2 is  it's all small stuff.
author: Robert Eliot

quote: If only the people who worry about their liabilities would think about the riches they do possess  they would stop worrying. Would you sell both your eyes for a million dollars ... or your two legs ... or your hands ... or your hearing? Add up what you do have  and you'll find that you won't sell them for all the gold in the world. The best things in life are yours  if you can appreciate yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: You'll break the worry habit the day you decide you can meet and master the worse that can happen to you.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Of course I realized there was a measure of danger. Obviously I faced the possibility of not returning when I first considered going. Once faced and settled there really wasn't any good reason to refer to it again.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The worst is not so long as we can say  "This is the worst."
author: William Shakespeare

quote: What is there to be afraid of? The worst thing that can happen is you fail. So what? I failed at a lot of things. My first record was horrible.
author: John Mellencamp

quote: When you first learn to love hell  you will be in heaven.
author: Thaddeus Golas

quote: Accept that all of us can be hurt  that all of us can-and surely will at times-fail. Other vulnerabilities  like being embarrassed or risking love  can be terrifying  too. I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: A wise man fights to win  but he is twice a fool who has no plan for possible defeat.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: There are people who are always anticipating trouble  and in this way they manage to enjoy many sorrows that never really happen.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The expectation of an unpleasantness is more terrible than the thing itself.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: Our worst misfortunes never happen  and most miseries lie in anticipation.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Some men storm imaginary Alps all their lives  and die in the foothills cursing difficulties which do not exist.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: How much pain they have cost us  the evils which have never happened.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: What torments of grief you endured  from evils that never arrived.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck  and the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: This was a great year for preventive worrying. Seldom in recent history have so many people worried about so many things that didn't happen in the end.
author: James Reston

quote: I remember the story of the old man who said on his deathbed that he had had a lot of trouble in his life  most of which never happened.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
author: Elie Metchnikoff

quote: Some of your hurts you have cured  And the sharpest you still have survived  But what torments of grief you endured From the evil which never arrived.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I am an old man and have known a great many troubles  but most of them never happened.
author: Mark Twain

quote: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes  most of which never happened.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Though life is made up of mere bubbles 'Tis better than many have  For while we've a whole lot of troubles The most of them never occur.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: If you see ten troubles coming down the road  you can be sure that nine will run into the ditch before they reach you.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: The crisis you have to worry about most is the one you don't see coming.
author: Mike Mansfield

quote: Other Definitions of Worry Anxiety is the great modern plague. But faith can cure it.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Worry is the only insupportable misfortune of life.
author: Henry Saint John

quote: Worry is the cross which we make for ourselves by overanxiety.
author: Francois de Fenelon

quote: Worry is interest paid on trouble before it comes due.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Worry is a morbid anticipation of events which never happen.
author: Russell Green

quote: Worry is the sin we're not afraid to commit.
author: Anonymous

quote: That man is blest Who does his best And leaves the rest  Then-do not worry.
author: Charles F. Deems

quote: Happy the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind  and has given up worrying  once and for all.
author: Ovid

quote: If things happen all the time you are never nervous. It is when they are not happening that you are nervous.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Stop worrying about the potholes in the road and celebrate the journey!
author: Barbara Hoffman

quote: A request not to worry ... is perhaps the least soothing message capable of human utterance.
author: Mignon G. Eberhart

quote: It is the little things that fret and worry us  you can dodge an elephant  but not a fly.
author: Josh Billings

quote: To be rich is not the end  but only a change  of worries.
author: Epicurus

quote: A man ninety years old was asked to what he attributed his longevity. "I reckon " he said  with a twinkle in his eye  "it's because most nights I went to bed and slept when I should have sat up and worried."
author: Dorothea Kent

quote: Worry less about what other people think about you  and more about what you think about them.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Don't hurry  don't worry. You're only here for a short visit. So be sure to stop and smell the flowers.
author: Walter Hagen

quote: Every faculty and virtue I possess can be used as an instrument with which to worry myself.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: What worries you  masters you.
author: Haddon W. Robinson

quote: Worry is most apt to ride you ragged not when you are in action  but when the day's work is done. Your imagination can run riot then ... your mind is like a motor operating without its load.
author: James L. Muresell

quote: "Worry" is a word that I don't allow myself to use.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Real difficulties can be overcome  it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
author: Theodore N. Vail

quote: It is only when men begin to worship that they begin to grow.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: And what greater calamity can fall upon a nation than the loss of worship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Ay  call it holy ground  The soil where first they trod. They have left unstained  what there they found -  Freedom to worship God.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: Yet  if he would  man cannot live all to this world. If not religious  he will be superstitious. If he worship not the true God  he will have his idols.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: This was the penn'worth of his thought.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: Nothing common can seem worthy of you.
author: Cicero

quote: Worth makes the man  and want of it the fellow  The rest is all but leather and prunello.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The game is not worth the candle.
author: French proverb

quote: Of whom the world was not worthy.
author: Hebrews

quote: Victories that are cheap are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The greater the difficulty  the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

quote: But the fruit that can fall without shaking indeed is too mellow for me.
author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: The greater the obstacle  the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

quote: The harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheaply  we esteem too lightly  'tis dearness only that gives everything its value.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the last generation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: To conquer without risk is to triumph without glory.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: There could be no honor in a sure success  but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: In order to have great happiness  you have to have great pain and unhap-piness - otherwise how would you know when you're happy?
author: Leslie Caron

quote: To really enjoy the better things in life  one must first have experienced the things they are better than.
author: Oscar Homolka

quote: There is no victory without pain.
author: Lolita Lebron

quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart don't know how to laugh either.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Excellence costs a great deal.
author: May Sarton

quote: If you want a place in the sun  you've got to put up with a few blisters.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Misfortunes tell us what fortune is.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity till he has tasted adversity.
author: Sa'di

quote: Who has never tasted what is bitter does not know what is sweet.
author: German proverb

quote: Victory is sweetest when you've known defeat.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: No man better knows what good is than he who has endured evil.
author: Anonymous

quote: He that has never suffered extreme adversity knows not the full extent of his own depravation.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sleep  riches and health  to be truly enjoyed  must be interrupted.
author: Jean Paul Fichter

quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.
author: Mary Tyler Moore

quote: If there were no tribulation  there would be no rest  if there were no winter  there would be no summer.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: If you want the rainbow  you gotta put up with the rain.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: If you want to see the sun shine  you have to weather the storm.
author: Frank Lane

quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: I have lived long enough to be battered by the realities of life  and not too long to be downed by them.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: If you will call your troubles experiences  and remember that every experience develops some latent force within you  you will grow vigorous and happy  however adverse your circumstances may seem to be.
author: John Heywood

quote: If your house is on fire  warm yourself by it.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A broken heart is what makes life so wonderful five years later  when you see the guy in an elevator and he is fat and smoking a cigar and saying "long-time-no-see." If he hadn't broken your heart  you couldn't have that glorious feeling of relief!
author: Phyllis Battelle

quote: Anything other than death is a minor injury.
author: Bill Muncey

quote: The most valuable gift I ever received was the gift of insecurity my father left us. My mother's love might not have prepared me for life the way my father's departure did. He forced us out on the road  where we had to earn our bread.
author: Lillian Gish

quote: Being disabled gave me an immense advantage. People are kinder to you. It puts you on a different level than if you go into a situation whole and secure.
author: Dorothea Lange

quote: When written in Chinese  the word "crisis" is composed of two characters. One represents danger  and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: From a fallen tree  make kindling.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Our real blessings often appear to us in the shape of pains  losses and disappointments  but let us have patience  and we soon shall see them in their proper figures.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: The same wind that extinguishes a light can set a brazier on fire.
author: Pierre de Beaumarchais

quote: Other Definitions of Adversity Adversity is the touchstone of virtue.
author: Anonymous

quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Glee! The great storm is over!
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Diseases can be our spiritual flat tires - disruptions in our lives that seem to be disasters at the time  but end by redirecting our lives in a meaningful way.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: To say that my grief will be eternal would be ridiculous - nothing is eternal.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: What the student calls a tragedy  the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Our way is not soft grass  it's a mountain path with lots of rocks. But it goes upwards  forward  toward the sun.
author: Dr. Ruth Westheimer

quote: Until you've lost your reputation  you never realize what a burden it was or what freedom really is.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Failure is  in a sense  the highway to success  inasmuch as every discovery of what is false leads us to seek earnestly after what is true  and very fresh experience points out some form of error which we shall afterward carefully avoid.
author: John Keats

quote: Although the world is full of suffering  it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There is in the worst of fortune the best of chances for a happy change.
author: Euripides

quote: Let us not be needlessly bitter: certain failures are sometimes fruitful.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: It is only after an unknown number of unrecorded labors  after a host of noble hearts have succumbed in discouragement  convinced that their cause is lost  it is only then that cause triumphs.
author: Madame Guizot

quote: When you can't remember why you're hurt  that's when you're healed. When you have to work real hard to re-create the pain  and you can't quite get there  that's when you're better.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: However confused the scene of our life appears  however torn we may be who now do face that scene  it can be faced  and we can go on to be whole.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: In adversity  remember to keep an even mind.
author: Horace

quote: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender  that is strength.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience  but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Do not free a camel of the burden of his hump  you may be freeing him from being a camel.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: I walk firmer and more secure up hill than down.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Adversity is like the period of the rain ... cold  comfortless  unfriendly to man and to animal  yet from that season have their birth the flower  the fruit  the date  the rose and the pomegranate.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: If we survive danger  it steels our courage more than anything else.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The virtue of adversity is fortitude  which in mortals is the heroical virtue.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: To turn an obstacle to one's advantage is a great step towards victory.
author: French proverb

quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards  they simply unveil them to the eyes of men ... crisis shows us what we have become.
author: Bishop Westcott

quote: Strong men greet war  tempest  hard times. They wish  as Pindar said  to tread the floors of hell  with necessities as hard as iron.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What deep wounds ever closed without a scar? The hearts bleed longest  and but heal to wear That which disfigures it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A certain Samaritan... bound up his wounds  pouring in oil and wine.
author: Bible

quote: I was wounded in the house of my friends.
author: Old Testament Zechariah

quote: I keep six honest serving men. (They taught me all I know)  Their names are What and Why and When and How and Where and Who.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Agatha Christie has given more pleasure in bed than any other woman.
author: Nancy Banks-Smith

quote: An original writer is not one who imitates nobody  but one whom nobody can imitate.
author: Francois Rene De Chateaubriand

quote: Autobiography is a preemptive strike against biographers.
author: Barbara G. Harris

quote: Begin with another's to end with your own.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Dr. Johnson's sayings would not appear so extraordinary were it not for his bow-wow way.
author: Henry Herbert

quote: Every other author may aspire to praise  the lexicographer can only hope to escape reproach.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I am being frank about myself in this book. I tell of my first mistake on page 850.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: I am not learning definitions as established in even the latest dictionaries. I am not a dictionary-maker. I am a person a dictionary-maker has to contend with. I am a living evidence in the development of language.
author: William Stafford

quote: I have this feeling of wending my way or plundering through a mysterious jungle of possibilities when I am writing. This jungle has not been explored by previous writers. It never will be explored. It's endlessly varying as we progress through the experience of time. These words that occur to me come out of my relation to the language which is developing even as I am using it.
author: William Stafford

quote: I have tried lately to read Shakespeare  and found it so intolerably dull that it nauseated me.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: In Ireland  a writer is looked upon as a failed conversationalist.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is a sad fact about our culture that a poet can earn much more money writing or talking about his art than he can by practising it.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Make'em laugh  make 'em cry  make 'em wait.
author: Charles Reade

quote: Many a fervid man writes books as cold and flat as graveyard stones.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Memoirs: the backstairs of history.
author: George Meredith

quote: No tears and the writer  no tears and the reader.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The pen is mightier than the sword.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: The work of Henry James has always seemed divisible by a simple dynastic arrangement into three reigns: James 1st  James 2nd  and the Old Pretender.
author: Philip Guedalla

quote: There are three difficulties in authorship: to write anything worth the publishing  to find honest men to publish it  and to get sensible men to read it.
author: C. C. Colton

quote: This morning I took out a comma and this afternoon I put it back again.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Thought flies and words go on foot.
author: Julien Green

quote: To write is to become disinterested. There is a certain renunciation in art.
author: Albert Camus

quote: What I like in a good author is not what he says  but what he whispers.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: When my journal appears  many statues must come down.
author: Duke of Wellington

quote: Writers aren't exactly people  they're a whole lot of people trying to be one person.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Writing is not a profession but a vocation of unhappiness.
author: Georges Simenon

quote: Writing is one of the easiest things: erasing is one of the hardest.
author: Rabbi Israel Salanter

quote: Writing is turning one's worst moments into money.
author: J. P. Donleavy

quote: You cannot write in the chimney with charcoal.
author: Russian proverb

quote: The truth is  we've not really developed a fiction that can accommodate the full tumult  the zaniness and crazed quality of modern experience.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Take care of the sense and the sounds will take of care themselves.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: There is today an extraordinary interest with the data of modern experience per se. Our absorption in our contemporary historical state is very high right now. It's not altogether unlike a similar situation in seventeenth century Holland  where wealthy merchants wanted their portraits done with all their blemishes included. It is the height of egotism  in a sense  to think even one's blemishes are of significance. So today Americans seem to want their writers to reveal all their weaknesses  their meannesses  to celebrate their very confusions. And they want it in the most direct possible way - they want it served up neat  as it were  without the filtering and generalizing power of fiction.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: I can write better than anyone who can write faster  and I can write faster than anyone who can write better.
author: A. J. Liebling

quote: Writing: I certainly do rewrite my central myth in every book  and would never read or trust any writer who did not also do so.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Every human being has hundreds of separate people living under his skin. The talent of a writer is his ability to give them their separate names  identities  personalities and have them relate to other characters living with him.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: There is one last thing to remember: writers are always selling somebody out.
author: Joan Didion

quote: The writer must write what he has to say  not speak it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Writers should be read - but neither seen nor heard.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: A person who publishes a book appears willfully in public with his pants down.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: The beginning is easy  what happens next is much harder.
author: Anonymous

quote: There should be two main objectives in ordinary prose writing: to convey a message and to include in it nothing that will distract the reader's attention or check his habitual pace of reading - he should feel that he is seated at ease in a taxi  not riding a temperamental horse through traffic.
author: Robert Graves

quote: If we try to envisage an 'average Canadian writer' we can see him living near a campus  teaching at least part-time at university level  mingling too much for his work's good with academics  doing as much writing as he can for the CBC  and always hoping for a Canada Council Fellowship.
author: George Woodcock

quote: The writer is committed when he plunges to the very depths of himself with the intent to disclose  not his individuality  but his person in the complex society that conditions and supports him.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I struggled in the beginning. I said I was going to write the truth  so help me God. And I thought I was. I found I couldn't. Nobody can write the absolute truth.
author: Henry Miller

quote: For a dyed-in-the-wool author nothing is as dead as a book once it is written ... she is rather like a cat whose kittens have grown up. While they were a-growing she was passionately interested in them but now they seem hardly to belong to her - and probably she is involved with another batch of kittens as I am involved with other writing.
author: Rumer Godden

quote: Every author  however modest  keeps a most outrageous vanity chained like a madman in the padded cell of his breast.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Never believe anything a writer tells you about himself. A man comes to believe in the end the lies he tells himself about himself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I am always at a loss to know how much to believe of my own stories.
author: Washington Irving

quote: That's not writing  that's typing.
author: Truman Capote

quote: There is an accuracy that defeats itself by the overemphasis of details. I often say that one must permit oneself  and quite advisedly and deliberately  a certain margin of misstatement.
author: Benjamin N. Cardozo

quote: I suppose some editors are failed writers - but so are most writers.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I think with my right hand.
author: Edmund Wilson

quote: Writers are the engineers of human souls.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: I quote others in order to better express my own self.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A great many people now reading and writing would be better employed in keeping rabbits.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: The process of writing a book is infinitely more important than the book that is completed as a result of the writing  let alone the success or failure that book may have after it is written . . . the book is merely a symbol of the writing. In writing the book  I am living. I am growing. I am tapping myself. I am changing. The process is the product.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Writing is no trouble: you just jot down ideas as they occur to you. The jotting is simplicity itself- it is the occurring which is difficult.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Writing  when properly managed (as you may be sure I think mine is) is but a different name for conversation.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: My method is to take the utmost trouble to find the right thing to say  and then to say it with the utmost levity.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Caesar had perished from the world of men Had not his sword been rescued by his pen.
author: Henry Vaughan

quote: Every great and original writer  in proportion as he is great and original  must himself create the taste by which he is to be relished.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Writers write to influence their readers  their preachers  their auditors  but always  at bottom  to be more themselves.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We are as much informed of a writer's genius by what he selects as by what he originates.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In any really good subject  one has only to probe deep enough to come to tears.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: He is limp and damp and milder than the breath of a cow.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The most essential gift for a good writer is a built-in  shockproof shit detector. This is the writer's radar and all great writers have had it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Get black on white.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: It is a sobering thought that each of us gives his hearers and his readers a chance to look into the inner working of his mind when he speaks or writes.
author: J. M. Barker

quote: Read over your compositions  and when you meet a passage which you think is particularly fine  strike it out.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: When you're a writer  you no longer see things with the freshness of the normal person. There are always two figures that work inside you  and if you are at all intelligent you realize that you have lost something. But I think there has always been this dichotomy in a real writer. He wants to be terribly human  and he responds emotionally  but at the same time there's this cold observer who cannot cry.
author: Brian Moore

quote: When I am dead  I hope it may be said: 'His sins were scarlet  but his books were read.'
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: The best part of every author is in general to be found in his book  I assure you.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The obscurity of a writer is generally in proportion to his incapacity.
author: Quintilian

quote: Life cannot defeat a writer who is in love with writing - for life itself is a writer's love until death.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Just get it down on paper  and then we'll see what to do with it.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: Advice to young writers who want to get ahead without any annoying delays: don't write about Man  write about a man.
author: E. B. White

quote: Vigorous writing is concise. A sentence should contain no unnecessary words  a paragraph no unnecessary sentences  for the same reason that a drawing should have no unnecessary lines and a machine no unnecessary parts. This requires not that the writer make all his sentences short  or that he avoid all detail and treat his subjects only in outline  but that every word tell.
author: William Strunk

quote: Tennessee Williams said if he got rid of his demons  he would lose his angels.
author: Dakin Williams

quote: Self-expression is for babies and seals  where it can be charming. A writer's business is to affect the reader.
author: Vincent McHugh

quote: There is but one art  to omit.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: A man really writes for an audience of about ten persons. Of course if others like it  that is clear gain. But if those ten are satisfied  he is content.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: It is in the hard rockpile labour of seeking to win  hold  or deserve a reader's interest that the pleasant agony of writing comes in.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: Write something  even if it's just a suicide note.
author: Anonymous

quote: Flaubert had infinite correction to perform.
author: Roland Barthes

quote: Nature  not content with denying him the ability to think  has endowed him with the ability to write.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: Beauty and truth may be attributes of good writing  but if the writer deliberately aims at truth  he is likely to find that what he has hit is the didactic.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: When an author is yet living  we estimate his powers by his worst performance  and when he is dead  we rate them by his best.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A writer is someone who can make a riddle out of an answer.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: The man who is asked by an author what he thinks of his work is put to the torture and is not obliged to speak the truth.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Style is the hallmark of a temperament stamped upon the material at hand.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Every writer  without exception  is a masochist  a sadist  a peeping Tom  an exhibitionist  a narcissist  an injustice collector and a depressed person constantly haunted by fears of unproductivity.
author: Edmund Bergler

quote: My novels point out that the world consists entirely of exceptions.
author: Joyce Carey

quote: Less is more.
author: Robert Browning

quote: We like that a sentence should read as if its author  had he held a plough instead of a pen  could have drawn a furrow deep and straight to the end.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The reason a writer writes a book is to forget a book and the reason a reader reads one is to remember it.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: I work every day - or at least I force myself into office or room. I may get nothing done  but you don't earn bonuses without putting in time. Nothing may come for three months  but you don't earn the fourth without it.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: John the Baptist pretending to be Karl Marx.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every word she writes is a lie  including 'and' and 'the'.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: When you put down the good things you ought to have done  and leave out the bad things you did do - well  that's memoirs.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Journalism allows it's readers to witness history. Fiction gives its readers an opportunity to live it.
author: John Hersey

quote: His (the writer's) standard of fidelity to the truth should be so high that his invention  out of his experience  should produce a truer account than anything factual can be.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The most lasting reputation I have is for an almost ferocious aggressiveness  when in fact I am amiable  indulgent  affectionate  shy and rather timid at heart.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: The life of a writer is tragic: the more we advance  the farther there is to go and the more there is to say  the less time there is to say it.
author: Gabrielle Roy

quote: It is only through fiction and the dimension of the imaginary that we can learn something real about individual experience. Any other approach is bound to be general and abstract.
author: Nicola Chiaromonte

quote: When the style is fully formed  if it has a sweet undersong  we call it beautiful  and the writer may do what he likes in words or syntax.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I have only made this letter rather long because I have not had time to make it shorter.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: It makes a great difference in the force of a sentence whether a man be behind it or no.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Footnotes  the little dogs yapping at the heels of the text.
author: William James

quote: I like prefaces. I read them. Sometimes I do not read any further.
author: Malcolm Lowry

quote: As for style of writing  if one has anything to say  it drops from him simply and directly  as a stone falls to the ground.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Proper words in proper places  make the true definition of a style.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: They're fancy talkers about themselves  writers. If I had to give young writers advice  I would say don't listen to writers talking about writing or themselves.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The business of writing is one of the four or five most private things in the world.
author: Ethel Wilson

quote: I conceive that the right way to write a story for boys is to write so that it will not only interest boys but strongly interest any man who has ever been a boy. That immensely enlarges the audience.
author: Mark Twain

quote: He claimed his modest share of the general foolishness of the human race.
author: Irving Howe

quote: There are two kinds of writers - the great ones who can give you truths  and the lesser ones  who can only give you themselves.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: My own experience is that once a story has been written  one has to cross out the beginning and the end. It is there that we authors do most of our lying . . . one must ruthlessly suppress everything that is not concerned with the subject. If  in the first chapter  you say there is a gun hanging on the wall  you should make quite sure that it is going to be used further on in the story.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: (Writing) - the art of applying the seat of the pants to the seat of the chair.
author: Mary Heaton Worse

quote: All a writer has to do to get a woman is to say he's a writer. It's an aphrodisiac.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Publication is a self-invasion of privacy.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: It has been said that writing comes more easily if you have something to say.
author: Sholem Asch

quote: I've put my genius into my life  I've only put my talent into my works.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Fundamentally  all writing is about the same thing: it's about dying  about the brief flicker of time we have here  and the frustrations that it creates.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: I am what libraries and librarians have made me  with a little assistance from a professor of Greek and a few poets.
author: B. K. Sandwell

quote: Our society  like decadent Rome  has turned into an amusement society  with writers chief among the court jesters - not so much above the clatter as part of it.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: If you would be a reader  read  if a writer  write.
author: Epictetus

quote: A writer and nothing else: a man alone in a room with the English language  trying to get human feelings right.
author: John K. Hutchens

quote: How can I know what I think till I see what I say?
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Please  never despise the translator. He's the mailman of human civilization.
author: Alexander Pushkin

quote: The waste basket is a writer's best friend.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: The llama is a woolly sort of fleecy hairy goat With an indolent expression and an undulating throat - Like an unsuccessful literary man.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: If a man means his writing seriously  he must mean to write well. But how can he write well until he learns to see what he has written badly. His progress toward good writing and his recognition of bad writing are bound to unfold at something like the same rate.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Words and sentences are subjects of revision  paragraphs and whole compositions are subjects of prevision.
author: Barrett Wendell

quote: There is nothing more dangerous to the formation of a prose style than the endeavour to make it poetic.
author: J. Middleton Murry

quote: The most original thing a writer can do is write like himself. It is also his most difficult task.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Now as through this world I ramble  I see lots of funny men  Some rob you with a six gun Some with a fountain pen.
author: Woody Guthrie

quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene  and  as if by magic  we see a new meaning in it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public  than to write for the public and have no self.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: I have cultivated my hysteria with joy and terror.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Writing has power  but its power has no vector. Writers can stir the mind  but they can't direct it. Time changes things  God changes things  the dictators change things  but writers can't change anything.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: A good writer is basically a story-teller  not a scholar or a redeemer of mankind.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Anybody can find out if he is a writer. If he were a writer  when he tried to write of some particular day  he would find in the effort that he could recall exactly how the light fell and how the temperature felt  and all the quality of it. Most people cannot do it. If they can do it  they may never be successful in a pecuniary sense  but that ability is at the bottom of writing  I am sure.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: I believe the writer... should always be the final judge. I have always held to that position and have sometimes seen books hurt thereby  but at least as often helped. The book belongs to the author.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: You have to throw yourself away when you write.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: A memorandum is written to protect the writer - not to inform his reader.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: I write for myself and strangers. The strangers  dear Readers  are an afterthought.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims  one turns as if it were instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms  like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
author: George Orwell

quote: A novel must be exceptionally good to live as long as the average cat.
author: Hugh MacLennan

quote: You praise the firm restraint with which they write - I'm with you  there  of course: They use the snaffle and the curb all right  But where's the bloody horse?
author: Roy Campbell

quote: At least half the mystery novels published violate the law that the solution  once revealed  must seem to be inevitable.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: On the trail of another man  the biographer must put up with finding himself at every turn: any biography uneasily shelters an autobiography within it.
author: Paul Murray Kendall

quote: The editorial job has become  unlike the ancient age when one judged what one read  a job of making judgements on outlines  ideas  reputations  previous books  scenarios  treatments  talk and promises.
author: Sam Vaughan

quote: An editor should tell the author his writing is better than it is. Not a lot better  a little better.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Writing is a solitary occupation. Family  friends and society are the natural enemies of a writer. He must be alone  uninterrupted and slightly savage if he is to sustain and complete an undertaking.
author: Laurence Clark Powell

quote: Just as there is nothing between the admirable omelette and the intolerable  so with autobiography.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: How can you write if you can't cry?
author: Ring Lardner

quote: I think it's bad to talk about one's present work  for it spoils something at the root of the creative act. It discharges the tension.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: As for my next book  I am going to hold myself from writing it till I have it impending in me: grown heavy in my mind like a ripe pear  pendant  gravid  asking to be cut or it will fall.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: No man understands a deep book until he has seen and lived at least part of its contents.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Writing is easy: all you do is sit staring at the blank sheet of paper until the drops of blood form on your forehead.
author: Gene Fowler

quote: Your manuscript is both good and original  but the parts that are good are not original  and the parts that are original are not good.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The reason why so few good books are written is that so few people who can write know anything.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: Whatever we conceive well we express clearly.
author: Nicolas Boileau

quote: Talent alone cannot make a writer. There must be a man behind the book.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Writers seldom write the things they think. They simply write the things they think other folks think they think.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Think much  speak little  and write less.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Bad writers are those who try to express their own feeble ideas in the language of good ones.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: A man may write himself out of reputation when nobody else can do it.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The multitude is always in the wrong.
author: Wentworth Dillon

quote: Two wrongs do not make a right.
author: English proverb

quote: It is better to suffer wrong than to do it  and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Truth forever on the scaffold  wrong forever on the throne.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The remedy for wrongs is to forget them.
author: Syrus

quote: Blessed are the young  for they shall inherit the national debt.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: When a man of 40 falls in love with a girl of 20  it isn't her youth he is seeking but his own.
author: Lenore Coffee

quote: Whom the gods love  die young  no matter how long they live.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Young folk  silly folk  old folk  cold folk.
author: Old saying

quote: In early youth  as we contemplate our coming life  we are like children in a theatre before the curtain is raised  sitting there in high spirits and eagerly waiting for the play to begin.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Much may be made of a Scotchman if he be caught young.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Young men think old men fools and old men know young men to be so.
author: Anonymous

quote: It takes a long time to become young.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The belief that youth is the happiest time of life is founded upon a fallacy. The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts  and we grow happier as we grow older.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: When I was a boy of fourteen  my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one  I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is essential that we enable young people to see themselves as participants in one of the most exciting eras in history  and to have a sense of purpose in relation to it.
author: Nelson Rockefeller

quote: This is a youth-oriented society  and the joke is on them because youth is a disease from which we all recover.
author: Anonymous

quote: Oh  to be only half as wonderful as my child thought I was when he was small  and only half as stupid as my teenager now thinks I am.
author: Rebecca Richards

quote: When I was younger  I could remember anything  whether it had happened or not.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The deepest definition of youth is life as yet untouched by tragedy.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Only the young die good.
author: Oliver Herford

quote: I am constantly amazed when I talk to young people to learn how much they know about sex and how little about soap.
author: Billie Burke

quote: The joy of the young is to disobey - but the trouble is that there are no longer any orders.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: To keep clear of concealment  to keep clear of the need of concealment  to do nothing that he might not do out on the middle of Boston Common at noonday -I cannot say how more and more that seems to me to be the glory of a young man's life. It is an awful hour when the first necessity of hiding anything comes. The whole life is different thenceforth. When there are questions to be feared and eyes to be avoided and subjects that must not be touched  then the bloom of life is gone. Put off that day as long as possible. Put if off forever if you can.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: Youth has become a class.
author: Roger Vadim

quote: The 'teenager' seems to have replaced the Communist as the appropriate target for public controversy and foreboding.
author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

quote: Everyone believes in his youth that the world really began with him  and that all merely exists for his sake.
author: Goethe

quote: It is not possible for civilization to flow backward while there is youth in the world. Youth may be headstrong  but it will advance its allotted length.
author: Helen Keller

quote: You never see the old austerity That was the essence of civility  Young people hereabouts  unbridled  now Just want.
author: Moliere

quote: The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: One boy's a boy  two boys are half a boy  three boys are no boy at all.
author: Charles A. Lindbergh

quote: Trouble is  kids feel they have to shock their elders and each generation grows up into something harder to shock.
author: Cal Craig

quote: I do beseech you to direct your efforts more to preparing youth for the path and less to preparing the path for the youth.
author: Ben Lindsey

quote: Every generation is a secret society and has incommunicable enthusiasms  tastes  and interests which are a mystery both to its predecessors and to posterity.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: The interests of childhood and youth are the interests of mankind.
author: Edmund Storer James

quote: The youth gets together this material to build a bridge to the moon  or perchance  a palace or temple on earth  and at length  the middle-aged man concludes to build a woodshed with them.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Don't laugh at a youth for his affectations  he's only trying on one face after another till he finds his own.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: If one could recover the uncompromising spirit of one's youth  one's greatest indignation would be for what one has become.
author: Andre Gide

quote: It is always self-defeating to pretend to the style of a generation younger than your own  it simply erases your own experience in history.
author: Renata Adler

quote: It's all that the young can do for the old  to shock them and keep them up to date.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: What though youth gave love and roses Age still leaves us friends and wine.
author: Thomas More

quote: In the lexicon of youth  which fate reserves For a bright manhood  there is no such word As fail.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Ah! happy years! once more who would not be a boy!
author: Lord Byron

quote: As I approve of a youth that has something of the old man in him  so I am no less pleased with an old man that has something of the youth. He that follows this rule may be old in body  but can never be so in mind.
author: Cicero

quote: I remember my youth and the feeling that will never come back any more - the feeling that I could last forever  outlast the sea  the earth  and all men.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Reckless youth makes rueful age.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: In youth we learn  in age we understand.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Youth will be served.
author: English proverb

quote: Forty is the old age of youth  fifty is the youth of old age.
author: French proverb

quote: Yes  you may depend upon it he has the ability! He is the younger generation that stands ready to knock at my door - to make an end of Halvard Solness.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Youth! youth! how buoyant are thy hopes  they turn  Like marigolds  toward the sunny side.
author: Jean Ingelow

quote: All the world's a mass of folly  Youth is gay  age melancholy: Youth is spending  age is thrifty  Mad at twenty  cold at fifty  Man is nought but folly's slave  From the cradle to the grave.
author: W. H. Ireland

quote: Your old men shall dream dreams  your young men shall see visions.
author: Bible

quote: Youth comes but once in a lifetime.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: How beautiful is youth! how bright it gleams With its illusions  aspirations  dreams! Book of Beginnings  Story without End  Each maid a heroine  and each man a friend!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: We think our fathers fools  so wise we grow  Our wiser sons  no doubt  will think us so.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: If youth but knew  and age were able  Then poverty would be a fable.
author: Proverbs

quote: Keep true to the dreams of thy youth.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Ah sorts of allowances are made for the illusions of youth  and none  or almost none  for the disenchantments of age.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Crabbed age and youth cannot live together  Youth is full of pleasure  age is full of care  Youth like summer morn  age like winter weather  Youth like summer brave  age like winter bare. Youth is full sport  age's breath is short  Youth is nimble  age is lame  Youth is hot and bold  age is weak and cold  Youth is wild  age is tame. Age  I do abhor thee  youth  I do adore thee.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: For God's sake give me the young man who has brains enough to make a fool of himself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Live as long as you may  the first twenty years are the longest half of your life.
author: Robert Southey

quote: She bid me take love easy  as the leaves grow on the tree  But I  being young and foolish  with her would not agree.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Zeal is very blind  or badly regulated  when it encroaches upon the rights of others.
author: Pasquier Quesnel

quote: Blind zeal can only do harm.
author: Magnus Gottfried Lichtwer

quote: My zeal hath consumed me.
author: Bible

quote: To be furious in religion is to be irreligiously religious.
author: William Penn

quote: Here too, as in the Commune almost a century earlier, the struggle was articulated around the hope that 'the antithesis between the everyday and the Festival--whether of labour or of leisure--will no longer be a basis for society.
